block.text: <<Diqqәtli olun, hәr cür tamahkarlıqdan özünüzü qoruyun. Çünki insanın hәyatı var-yoxunun bolluğundan asılı deyil>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke a parable to them, saying,

block.text: İsa onlara bu mәsәli danışdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The ground of a certain rich man brought forth abundantly.

block.text: <<Bir varlının torpağı bol mәhsul verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He reasoned within himself, saying, ‘What will I do, because I don't have room to store my crops?’

block.text: Bu adam ürәyindә düşündü: “Mәhsulumu qoymağa yerim yoxdur. Axı nә edim?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said, ‘This is what I will do. I will pull down my barns, and build bigger ones, and there I will store all my grain and my goods.

block.text: Sonra dedi: “Belә edәrәm: anbarlarımı söküb daha böyüklәrini tikәcәyәm. Bütün taxılımı vә malımı oraya yığaram.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will tell my soul, “Soul, you have many goods laid up for many years. Take your ease, eat, drink, be merry.”’”

block.text: Canıma deyәrәm: ey canım, illәrlә kifayәt qәdәr var-dövlәt yığmısan. İndi dincәl, ye-iç, kef elә”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But God said to him, ‘You foolish one, tonight your soul is required of you. The things which you have prepared--whose will they be?’

block.text: Amma Allah ona dedi: “Ay axmaq, bu gecә canını sәndәn alacaqlar. Bәs hazırladığın kimә qalacaq?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is the same for one who lays up treasure for himself, and is not rich toward God.”

block.text: Özü üçün xәzinә toplayan, amma Allahın önündә varlı olmayan hәr bir insanın axırı da elә olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to his disciples,

block.text: İsa Öz şagirdlәrinә belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore I tell you, don't be anxious for your life, what you will eat, nor yet for your body, what you will wear.

block.text: <<Buna görә sizә deyirәm: “Nә yeyәcәyik?” deyә canınız üçün, “Nә geyinәcәyik?” deyә bәdәniniz üçün qayğı çәkmәyin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Life is more than food, and the body is more than clothing.

block.text: Can yemәkdәn, bәdәnsә geyinmәkdәn daha vacibdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Consider the ravens: they don't sow, they don't reap, they have no warehouse or barn, and God feeds them. How much more valuable are you than birds!

block.text: Qarğalara baxın: onlar nә әkir, nә dә biçir, nә anbarları, nә dә zirzәmilәri var. Amma Allah onları yedizdirir. Siz quşlardan nә qәdәr qiymәtlisiniz!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which of you by being anxious can add a cubit to his height?

block.text: Hansı biriniz qayğı çәkmәklә ömrünü bir anlıq belә, uzada bilәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If then you aren't able to do even the least things, why are you anxious about the rest?

block.text: Әgәr siz elә balaca şeyi etmәyi bacarmırsınızsa, nә üçün başqa şeylәrin qayğısını çәkirsiniz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Consider the lilies, how they grow. They don't toil, neither do they spin; yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.

block.text: Zanbaqların necә böyüdüyünә baxın: onlar nә zәhmәt çәkir, nә dә ip әyirir. Lakin sizә bunu deyirәm ki, bütün cah-calalı içindә olan Süleyman belә, bunlardan biri kimi geyinmәmişdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if this is how God clothes the grass in the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is cast into the oven, how much more will he clothe you, O you of little faith?

block.text: Ey imanı az olanlar, bu gün çöldә olub sabah ocağa atılan otu Allah belә geyindirirsә, sizi geyindirәcәyi nә qәdәr yәqindir!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't seek what you will eat or what you will drink; neither be anxious.

block.text: “Nә yeyәcәyik?”, “Nә içәcәyik?” deyә axtarıb narahat olmayın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the nations of the world seek after all of these things, but your Father knows that you need these things.

block.text: Çünki dünyadakı bütpәrәstlәr bütün bu şeylәri axtarırlar. Doğrudan da, Atanız bunlara ehtiyacınız olduğunu bilir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But seek God's Kingdom, and all these things will be added to you.

block.text: Lakin siz Allahın Padşahlığını axtarın, onda bunlar da sizә әlavә olaraq verilәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don't be afraid, little flock, for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the Kingdom.

block.text: Qorxma, ey kiçik sürü! Çünki Atanız Padşahlığı sizә vermәyi münasib gördü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Sell that which you have, and give gifts to the needy. Make for yourselves purses which don't grow old, a treasure in the heavens that doesn't fail, where no thief approaches, neither moth destroys.

block.text: Әmlakınızı satın vә sәdәqә verin. Özünüzә köhnәlmәyәn kisәlәr, göylәrdә tükәnmәyәn xәzinә hazırlayın. Oraya nә oğru gәlәr, nә dә onu güvә yeyәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.”

block.text: Çünki xәzinәniz haradadırsa, ürәyiniz dә orada olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be ready and dressed. Have your lamps burning.

block.text: <<Qoy qurşaqlarınız bellәrinizdә bağlı vә çıraqlarınız yana-yana qalsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be like men watching for their lord, when he returns from the marriage feast; that, when he comes and knocks, they may immediately open to him.

block.text: Toy ziyafәtindәn qayıdan ağasını gözlәyәn adamlara oxşayın. Onlar ağaları gәlib qapını döyәn kimi qapını açmağa hazır olurlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are those servants, whom the lord will find watching when he comes. Most certainly I tell you, that he will dress himself, and make them recline, and will come and serve them.

block.text: Nә bәxtiyardır o qullar ki, ağa qayıdanda onları oyaq görür! Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: o özü qurşaqlanıb qullarını süfrәyә otuzduracaq vә gәlib onlara xidmәt edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will be blessed if he comes in the second or third watch, and finds them so.

block.text: Ağa istәr gecәyarı, istәr ondan gec, sәhәrә yaxın gәlib qulları oyaq görsә, o qullar necә dә bәxtiyardır!

ReferenceBlocks.text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what hour the thief was coming, he would have watched, and not allowed his house to be broken into.

block.text: Amma bunu bilin ki, әgәr evin yiyәsi oğrunun hansı saatda gәlәcәyini bilsәydi, evinin yarılmasına imkan vermәzdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore be ready also, for the Son of Man is coming in an hour that you don't expect him.”

block.text: Belәcә siz dә hazır olun, çünki Bәşәr Oğlu gözlәmәdiyiniz vaxt gәlәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said to him,

block.text: Peter dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, are you telling this parable to us, or to everybody?”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, bu mәsәli ancaq bizә danışırsan, yoxsa hamıya?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: Rәbb cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who then is the faithful and wise steward, whom his lord will set over his household, to give them their portion of food at the right times?

block.text: <<Vaxtlı-vaxtında onlara yemәk vermәk üçün ağasının öz nökәrlәri üzәrinә qoyduğu sadiq vә ağıllı idarәçi kimdir?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is that servant whom his lord will find doing so when he comes.

block.text: Nә bәxtiyardır o qul ki, ağası evinә qayıdanda onu iş başında görür!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Truly I tell you, that he will set him over all that he has.

block.text: Sizә hәqiqәti deyirәm: ağası bu qula bütün әmlakı üzәrindә idarәçiliyi tapşıracaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But suppose that servant says in his heart, ‘My lord delays his coming,’ and begins to beat the menservants and the maidservants, and to eat and drink, and to be drunken.

block.text: Amma hәmin qul ürәyindә “ağam gec gәlәcәk” deyәrsә, başqa nökәr vә qarabaşları döymәyә, yeyib-içmәyә, sәrxoşluğa uymağa başlayarsa,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the lord of that servant will come in a day when he isn't expecting him, and in an hour that he doesn't know, and will cut him in two, and place his portion with the unfaithful.

block.text: o qulun ağası onun gözlәmәdiyi gün vә ağlına gәlmәdiyi vaxt gәlәcәk, ona ağır cәza verәcәk vә onu sәdaqәtsizlәrlә bir yerdә saxlayacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That servant, who knew his lord's will, and didn't prepare, nor do what he wanted, will be beaten with many stripes.

block.text: Ağasının istәyini bilib hazır olmayan vә onun istәyinә әmәl etmәyәn qul çox döyülәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he who didn't know, and did things worthy of stripes, will be beaten with few stripes. To whomever much is given, of him will much be required; and to whom much was entrusted, of him more will be asked.”

block.text: Bilmәyib o cәzaya layiq iş görәn isә az döyülәcәk. Kimә çox verilibsә, ondan çox da istәnilәcәk. Kimә çox tapşırılıbsa, ondan daha çox tәlәb olunacaq.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I came to throw fire on the earth. I wish it were already kindled.

block.text: Mәn yer üzünә od yağdırmağa gәlmişәm. Kaş ki bu od artıq alışıb-yanaydı!

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I have a baptism to be baptized with, and how distressed I am until it is accomplished!

block.text: Mәnim alacağım bir vәftiz var. Bu vәftiz yerinә yetib qurtaranadәk necә dә tәzyiq altında olmalıyam!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Do you think that I have come to give peace in the earth? I tell you, no, but rather division.

block.text: Siz düşünürsünüz ki, Mәn yer üzünә sülh gәtirmәyә gәlmişәm? Xeyr, sizә deyirәm ki, Mәn ayrılıq gәtirmәyә gәlmişәm!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For from now on, there will be five in one house divided, three against two, and two against three.

block.text: Çünki bundan sonra bir evdә yaşayan beş nәfәr bir-birindәn ayrılaraq üç nәfәrә qarşı iki nәfәr, iki nәfәrә qarşı üç nәfәr olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will be divided, father against son, and son against father; mother against daughter, and daughter against her mother; mother-in-law against her daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.”

block.text: Çünki ata oğlundan, oğul atasından, ana qızından, qız anasından, qayınana gәlinindәn, gәlin dә qayınanasından ayrılacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to the multitudes also,

block.text: İsa camaata bunu da dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you see a cloud rising from the west, immediately you say, ‘A shower is coming,’ and so it happens.

block.text: <<Siz qәrb tәrәfdәn qalxan buludu görәndә dәrhal “yağış yağacaq” deyirsiniz, bu da olur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When a south wind blows, you say, ‘There will be a scorching heat,’ and it happens.

block.text: Cәnub külәyinin әsmәsini görәndә “qızmar isti olacaq” deyirsiniz, bu da olur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You hypocrites! You know how to interpret the appearance of the earth and the sky, but how is it that you don't interpret this time?

block.text: Ey ikiüzlülәr, yer üzünün vә göyün görünüşünü seçә bilirsiniz, bәs onda nә üçün indiki zamanı seçә bilmirsiniz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why don't you judge for yourselves what is right?

block.text: Nә üçün düzgün olan şeyә özünüz qәrar vermirsiniz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For when you are going with your adversary before the magistrate, try diligently on the way to be released from him, lest perhaps he drag you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and the officer throw you into prison.

block.text: Sәni ittiham edәnlә birgә hakimin yanına gedәndә yolda ikәn onunla barışmağa çalış. Yoxsa sәni hakimin qabağına sürüyәr, hakim isә mәhkәmә icraçısına ötürәr, o da sәni zindana atar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, you will by no means get out of there, until you have paid the very last penny.”

block.text: Sәnә bunu deyirәm: axırıncı qәpik-quruşunu vermәyincә oradan әsla çıxmayacaqsan>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 13
Now there were some present at the same time who told him about the Galileans, whose blood Pilate had mixed with their sacrifices.
Jesus answered them,

block.text: Bu vaxt orada olan bәzi adamlar İsaya xәbәr verdilәr ki, Pilat bәzi Qalileyalıların qanını kәsdiklәri qurbanların qanına qatmışdı.
İsa buna belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you think that these Galileans were worse sinners than all the other Galileans, because they suffered such things?

block.text: <<Siz elә bilirsiniz ki, bu aqibәtә uğramış Qalileyalılar bütün digәr Qalileyalılardan daha betәr günahlı idilәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, no, but unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.

block.text: Xeyr, Mәn sizә deyirәm: tövbә etmәsәniz, hamınız onlar kimi mәhv olacaqsınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or those eighteen, on whom the tower in Siloam fell, and killed them; do you think that they were worse offenders than all the men who dwell in Jerusalem?

block.text: Yaxud Şiloah qüllәsi on sәkkiz adamın üstünә aşıb onları öldürәndә onların Yerusәlim sakinlәrinin hamısından tәqsirkar olduqlarını fikirlәşirsiniz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, no, but, unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.”

block.text: Xeyr, Mәn sizә deyirәm: tövbә etmәsәniz, hamınız onlar kimi mәhv olacaqsınız>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke this parable.

block.text: Sonra İsa bu mәsәli danışdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain man had a fig tree planted in his vineyard, and he came seeking fruit on it, and found none.

block.text: <<Bir adamın bağında bir әncir ağacı әkilmişdi. Bu adam gәlib ağacda meyvә axtardı, amma tapmadı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to the vine dresser, ‘Behold, these three years I have come looking for fruit on this fig tree, and found none. Cut it down. Why does it waste the soil?’

block.text: O, bağbana dedi: “Bura bax, üç ildir ki, mәn gәlib bu әncir ağacında meyvә axtarıram, amma tapmıram. Onu kәs! Nә üçün bu ağac әbәs yerә torpağı tutur?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered, ‘Lord, leave it alone this year also, until I dig around it, and fertilize it.

block.text: Bağban isә cavabında belә dedi: “Ağa, bir il dә buna әl dәymә. Mәn onu bellәyib dövrәsinә peyin tökәrәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If it bears fruit, fine; but if not, after that, you can cut it down.’”

block.text: Gәlәn il bu ağac meyvә gәtirsә, yaxşıdır. Әgәr vermәsә, onu kәsәrsәn”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was teaching in one of the synagogues on the Sabbath day.

block.text: İsa bir dәfә Şәnbә günü sinaqoqlardan birindә tәlim öyrәdirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, there was a woman who had a spirit of infirmity eighteen years, and she was bent over, and could in no way straighten herself up.

block.text: Orada on sәkkiz il daxilindә xәstәlik ruhu olan beli bükülmüş bir qadın var idi. O, belini heç düzәldә bilmirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus saw her, he called her, and said to her,

block.text: İsa bu qadını görәndә çağırıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, you are freed from your infirmity.”

block.text: <<Ey qadın, sәn azarından azad oldun>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He laid his hands on her and immediately she stood up straight and exclaimed:

block.text: Onu və öz əlləri qoymuş dərhal o qədər düz durdu və dedi:

block.characterId: woman who could not straighten up

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: woman who could not straighten up
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Glory be to God!”

block.text: "Şöhrət Allah olsun!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: The ruler of the synagogue, being indignant because Jesus had healed on the Sabbath, said to the multitude,

block.text: Amma sinaqoqun rәisi İsanın Şәnbә günü şәfa verdiyinә hiddәtlәnib camaata belә xitab etdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There are six days in which men ought to work. Therefore come on those days and be healed, and not on the Sabbath day!”

block.text: <<Altı gün әrzindә işlәmәk lazımdır, o günlәr gәlin vә şәfa alın, Şәnbә günü yox>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore the Lord answered him,

block.text: Rәbb isә ona belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You hypocrites! Doesn't each one of you free his ox or his donkey from the stall on the Sabbath, and lead him away to water?

block.text: <<Ey ikiüzlülәr, sizlәrdәn hәr biriniz Şәnbә günündә öz öküzünün ya eşşәyinin bağını açıb tövlәdәn su içmәyә aparmırmı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Ought not this woman, being a daughter of Abraham, whom Satan had bound eighteen long years, be freed from this bondage on the Sabbath day?”

block.text: İbrahimin qızı olan bu qadını da on sәkkiz il әrzindә Şeytan buxovlamışdı. Şәnbә günü bu qadının buxovlarını açmaq lazım deyildimi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he said these things, all his adversaries were disappointed, and all the multitude rejoiced for all the glorious things that were done by him.
He said,

block.text: İsa bunları deyәndә ona qarşı çıxanlar hamısı utandı. Camaatın hamısı isә Onun etdiyi bütün izzәtli işlәrinә görә sevinirdi.
Sonra İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is the Kingdom of God like? To what shall I compare it?

block.text: <<Allahın Padşahlığı nәyә bәnzәyir? Onu nәyә bәnzәdim?

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and put in his own garden. It grew, and became a large tree, and the birds of the sky lodged in its branches.”

block.text: O bir adamın bağçasına әkdiyi xardal toxumuna bәnzәyir. O toxum böyüyüb ağac olur. Göydә uçan quşlar onun budaqlarında yuva qurur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again he said,

block.text: İsa yenә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To what shall I compare the Kingdom of God?

block.text: <<Allahın Padşahlığını nәyә bәnzәdim?

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is like yeast, which a woman took and hid in three measures of flour, until it was all leavened.”

block.text: O, xәmir mayasına bәnzәyir. Qadın onu götürüb üç kisә una qarışdırıb bütün xәmir acıyanadәk saxlayır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went on his way through cities and villages, teaching, and traveling on to Jerusalem.
One said to him,

block.text: İsa şәhәr vә kәndlәri keçәrәk tәlim verib Yerusәlimә tәrәf gedirdi.
Bir nәfәr Ondan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, are only a few people going to be saved?”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, xilas tapanların sayı az olacaqmı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Strive to enter in by the narrow door, for many, I tell you, will seek to enter in, and will not be able.

block.text: <<Dar qapıdan girmәyә çalışın. Sizә bunu deyirәm: çoxları bu qapıdan girmәyә can atacaq, amma girә bilmәyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When once the master of the house has risen up, and has shut the door, and you begin to stand outside, and to knock at the door, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us!’ then he will answer and tell you, ‘I don't know you or where you come from.’

block.text: Ev yiyәsi durub qapını bağlayandan sonra siz bayırda durub qapını döyәrәk deyәcәksiniz: “Ey ağam, bizә qapını aç!” O isә cavabında sizә deyәcәk: “Mәn sizin haradan gәldiyinizi bilmirәm!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then you will begin to say, ‘We ate and drank in your presence, and you taught in our streets.’

block.text: Siz o vaxt belә deyәcәksiniz: “Biz Sәnin qarşında yeyib-içmişik. Sәn bizim küçәlәrdә öyrәdirdin”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will say, ‘I tell you, I don't know where you come from. Depart from me, all you workers of iniquity.’

block.text: O isә sizә deyәcәk: “Ey haqsızlıq edәnlәrin hamısı, Mәn sizin haradan gәldiyinizi bilmirәm, Mәndәn uzaq olun!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham, Isaac, Jacob, and all the prophets, in the Kingdom of God, and yourselves being thrown outside.

block.text: İbrahimi, İshaqı, Yaqubu vә bütün peyğәmbәrlәri Allahın Padşahlığında, özünüzü isә bayıra atılmış görәndә aranızda ağlaşma vә diş qıcırtısı olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will come from the east, west, north, and south, and will sit down in the Kingdom of God.

block.text: Adamlar şәrqdәn, qәrbdәn, şimaldan, cәnubdan gәlәcәk vә Allahın Padşahlığında süfrәyә oturacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, there are some who are last who will be first, and there are some who are first who will be last.”

block.text: Budur, elә axırıncılar var ki, birinci olacaq, elә birincilәr var ki, axırıncı olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: On that same day, some Pharisees came, saying to him,

block.text: O zaman bәzi fariseylәr gәlib İsaya dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get out of here, and go away, for Herod wants to kill you.”

block.text: <<Buradan çıx get, çünki Hirod Sәni öldürmәk istәyir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and tell that fox, ‘Behold, I cast out demons and perform cures today and tomorrow, and the third day I complete my mission.

block.text: <<Gedin o tülküyә deyin: “Budur, Mәn bu gün vә sabah cinlәri qovub camaatı sağaldacağam vә üçüncü gün işimi bitirәcәyәm”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Nevertheless I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, for it can't be that a prophet perish outside of Jerusalem.’”

block.text: Yenә dә bu gün, sabah vә o biri gün yoluma davam etmәliyәm. Çünki peyğәmbәr Yerusәlimdәn kәnarda öldürülә bilmәz!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, that kills the prophets, and stones those who are sent to her! How often I wanted to gather your children together, like a hen gathers her own brood under her wings, and you refused!

block.text: <<Ey Yerusәlim, Yerusәlim! Peyğәmbәrlәri öldürәn vә ora göndәrilәnlәri daşqalaq edәn şәhәr! Toyuq cücәlәrini qanadları altına yığan kimi Mәn dә dәfәlәrlә sәnin övladlarını yığmaq istәdim, sizsә istәmәdiniz!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, your house is left to you desolate. I tell you, you will not see me, until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”

block.text: Baxın, eviniz viran qalır. Mәn sizә bunu deyirәm: “Rәbbin ismi ilә Gәlәnә alqış olsun!” deyәnә qәdәr Mәni bir daha görmәyәcәksiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 14
It happened, when he went into the house of one of the rulers of the Pharisees on a Sabbath to eat bread, that they were watching him.

block.text: Bir Şәnbә günü İsa farisey rәhbәrlәrinin birinin evinә çörәk yemәyә getdi. Hamı Ona göz qoyurdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a certain man who had dropsy was in front of him.

block.text: Onun qarşısında hidropos xәstәliyinә tutulmuş bir adam var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, answering, spoke to the lawyers and Pharisees, saying,

block.text: İsa qanunşünas vә fariseylәrә xitab edәrәk soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?”

block.text: <<Şәnbә günü insanlara şәfa vermәyә icazә var ya yox?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they were silent. He took him, and healed him, and let him go.
He answered them,

block.text: Amma onlar dinmirdi. İsa o adama әli ilә toxundu, onu sağaltdı vә buraxdı.
İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which of you, if your son or an ox fell into a well, wouldn't immediately pull him out on a Sabbath day?”

block.text: <<Sizlәrdәn kimin oğlu yaxud öküzü Şәnbә günü quyuya düşsә, onu dәrhal oradan dartıb çıxarmaz?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They couldn't answer him regarding these things.

block.text: Onlar İsanın bu sualına cavab verә bilmәdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke a parable to those who were invited, when he noticed how they chose the best seats, and said to them,

block.text: İsa fikir verdi ki, dәvәt olunanlar yuxarı başda oturmağı seçdilәr. Onlara belә bir mәsәl söylәdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you are invited by anyone to a marriage feast, don't sit in the best seat, since perhaps someone more honorable than you might be invited by him.

block.text: <<Bir nәfәr sәni toya dәvәt edirsә, yuxarı başda oturma. Bәlkә ev yiyәsinin sәndәn dә hörmәtli bir qonağı var.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The one who invited both of you would come and tell you, ‘Make room for this person.’ Then you would begin, with shame, to take the lowest place.

block.text: İkinizi dә toya dәvәt edәn gәlib sәnә “bu adama yer ver” desә, sәn xәcalәt içindә aşağı başda әylәşmәli olarsan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you are invited, go and sit in the lowest place, so that when he who invited you comes, he may tell you, ‘Friend, move up higher.’ Then you will be honored in the presence of all who sit at the table with you.

block.text: Amma dәvәt olunanda gedib әn aşağı başda otur ki, sәni dәvәt edәn adam gәlib sәnә “Dostum! Yuxarı başa keç” desin; o zaman sәninlә birgә oturanların hamısının qarşısında hörmәt qazanarsan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted.”

block.text: Çünki özünü yüksәldәn hәr kәs aşağı tutulacaq, özünü aşağı tutansa yüksәldilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He also said to the one who had invited him,

block.text: İsa Onu dәvәt edәnә dә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When you make a dinner or a supper, don't call your friends, nor your brothers, nor your kinsmen, nor rich neighbors, or perhaps they might also return the favor, and pay you back.

block.text: <<Günorta yaxud axşam yemәyi verdiyin vaxt öz dostlarını, qardaşlarını, qohumlarını, dövlәtli qonşularını dәvәt etmә ki, onlar da sәni çağıraraq sәnә әvәzini versin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you make a feast, ask the poor, the maimed, the lame, or the blind;

block.text: Amma qonaqlıq verәndә yoxsulları, әlillәri, topalları, korları çağır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and you will be blessed, because they don't have the resources to repay you. For you will be repaid in the resurrection of the righteous.”

block.text: Onda onlar sәnә әvәzini verә bilmәdiyinә görә sәn bәxtiyar olacaqsan. Çünki salehlәr dirildiyi zaman sәnә әvәz verilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When one of those who sat at the table with him heard these things, he said to him,

block.text: Süfrәyә oturanlardan biri bunu eşidib İsaya dedi:

block.characterId: one at table of Pharisee (expert in religious law)

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: one at table of Pharisee (expert in religious law)
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed is he who will feast in the Kingdom of God!”

block.text: <<Allahın Padşahlığında çörәk yeyәn nә bәxtiyardır!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to him,

block.text: Amma İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain man made a great supper, and he invited many people.

block.text: <<Bir adam böyük ziyafәt hazırladı vә oraya çoxlu qonaq çağırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent out his servant at supper time to tell those who were invited, ‘Come, for everything is ready now.’

block.text: Yemәk vaxtı gәlәndә öz qulunu dәvәt olunanların yanına göndәrdi ki, onlara desin: “Buyurun, indi hәr şey hazırdır”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all as one began to make excuses. The first said to him, ‘I have bought a field, and I must go and see it. Please have me excused.’”

block.text: Amma hamı birdәn üzr istәmәyә başladı. Birincisi ona dedi: “Mәn bir torpaq sahәsi almışam, gedib ona baxmalıyam. Sәndәn xahiş edirәm, mәni bağışla”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Another said, ‘I have bought five yoke of oxen, and I must go try them out. Please have me excused.’”

block.text: Digәri isә dedi: “Mәn beş cüt öküz satın almışam vә onları yoxlamağa gedirәm. Sәndәn xahiş edirәm, mәni bağışla”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Another said, ‘I have married a wife, and therefore I can't come.’”

block.text: Üçüncüsü dedi: “Mәn tәzә evlәnmişәm, buna görә dә gәlә bilmәrәm”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “That servant came, and told his lord these things. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant, ‘Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in the poor, maimed, blind, and lame.’”

block.text: Qul qayıdıb bu şeylәri ağasına bildirdi. O zaman ev yiyәsi qәzәblәnib quluna dedi: “Qaç, şәhәrin küçә vә tinlәrindә olan yoxsulları, әlillәri, korları vә topalları buraya gәtir”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The servant said, ‘Lord, it is done as you commanded, and there is still room.’”

block.text: Qul isә dedi: “Ağa, sәnin әmrin yerinә yetirildi, hәlә artıq yer dә qalıb”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The lord said to the servant, ‘Go out into the highways and hedges, and compel them to come in, that my house may be filled.

block.text: <<Ağası quluna dedi: “Get, bütün yolları vә çәpәrlәri gәz. Evim dolsun deyә adamları gәlmәyә vadar et.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I tell you that none of those men who were invited will taste of my supper.’”

block.text: Sizә bunu deyirәm: ilk dәvәt olunanların heç biri mәnim ziyafәtimdәn dadmayacaq”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now great multitudes were going with him. He turned and said to them,

block.text: İsa ilә birlikdә böyük izdiham yol gedirdi. İsa dönüb onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If anyone comes to me, and doesn't disregard his own father, mother, wife, children, brothers, and sisters, yes, and his own life also, he can't be my disciple.

block.text: <<Kim Mәnim yanıma gәlib ata-anasını, arvad-uşaqlarını, bacı-qardaşlarını, hәtta öz hәyatını Mәndәn üstün tutsa, Mәnim şagirdim ola bilmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever doesn't bear his own cross, and come after me, can't be my disciple.

block.text: Öz çarmıxını daşıyıb ardımca gәlmәyәn kәs dә Mәnim şagirdim ola bilmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For which of you, desiring to build a tower, doesn't first sit down and count the cost, to see if he has enough to complete it?

block.text: Sizlәrdәn kimsә bir qüllә tikmәk istәyirsә, әvvәlcә oturub onun xәrclәrini hesablamaz ki, görsün onu qurtarmaq üçün pulu çatacaq ya yox?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or perhaps, when he has laid a foundation, and is not able to finish, everyone who sees begins to mock him,
saying, ‘This man began to build, and wasn't able to finish.’

block.text: Çünki qüllәnin tәmәlini qoyub işi qurtara bilmәsә, bunu görәnlәrin hamısı onu әlә salıb deyәcәk:
“Bu adam tikintiyә başlayıb qurtara bilmәdi”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or what king, as he goes to encounter another king in war, will not sit down first and consider whether he is able with ten thousand to meet him who comes against him with twenty thousand?

block.text: Yaxud da hansı padşah başqa padşahla müharibәyә gedәndә üstünә iyirmi min әsgәrlә gәlәnә qarşı on min әsgәrlә durmağa qadir olmağı әvvәlcә oturub götür-qoy elәmәz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or else, while the other is yet a great way off, he sends an envoy, and asks for conditions of peace.

block.text: Әgәr padşah buna qadir deyilsә, o biri padşahın hәlә uzaqda olduğu vaxt elçilәr göndәrib sülh müqavilәsi bağlamaq istәyәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So therefore whoever of you who doesn't renounce all that he has, he can't be my disciple.

block.text: Eyni tәrzdә sizdәn hәr biriniz bütün әmlakından әl çәkmәsә, Mәnim şagirdim ola bilmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Salt is good, but if the salt becomes flat and tasteless, with what do you season it?

block.text: Duz yaxşı şeydir, amma әgәr duz öz dadını itirәrsә, ona nә ilә dad verilә bilәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is fit neither for the soil nor for the manure pile. It is thrown out. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: O nә torpağa yarayar, nә dә peyinә. Onu çölә atarlar. Eşitmәyә qulağı olan eşitsin!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 15
Now all the tax collectors and sinners were coming close to him to hear him.

block.text: Bütün vergiyığanlar vә günahkarlar İsanı dinlәmәk üçün Ona yaxınlaşırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying,

block.text: Fariseylәr vә ilahiyyatçılar isә deyә deyinirdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man welcomes sinners, and eats with them.”

block.text: <<bu adam günahkarları qәbul edir vә onlarla yemәk yeyir>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He told them this parable.

block.text: Amma İsa onlara bu mәsәli çәkdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which of you men, if you had one hundred sheep, and lost one of them, wouldn't leave the ninety-nine in the wilderness, and go after the one that was lost, until he found it?

block.text: <<Sizlәrdәn birinin yüz qoyunu olsa vә onlardan birini itirsә, doxsan doqquzunu çöldә qoyub itmiş qoyunu tapanadәk onu axtarmazmı?

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he has found it, he carries it on his shoulders, rejoicing.

block.text: Tapanda isә onu sevinclә çiyinlәrinә qoyar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he comes home, he calls together his friends and his neighbors, saying to them, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found my sheep which was lost!’

block.text: Evә gәlәndә öz dostlarını vә qonşularını çağırıb belә deyәr: “Mәnimlә birlikdә sevinin, itmiş qoyunumu tapmışam!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that even so there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents, than over ninety-nine righteous people who need no repentance.

block.text: Sizә bunu deyirәm: belәcә dә göydә tövbә edәn bircә günahkara görә tövbәyә ehtiyacı olmayan doxsan doqquz saleh insan üçün olduğundan daha çox sevinc olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or what woman, if she had ten drachma coins, if she lost one drachma coin, wouldn't light a lamp, sweep the house, and seek diligently until she found it?

block.text: Yaxud on dirhәmi olan hansı bir qadın bir dirhәmini itirsә, çıraq yandırıb evi süpürәrәk onu tapanadәk diqqәtlә axtarmaz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: When she has found it, she calls together her friends and neighbors, saying, ‘Rejoice with me, for I have found the drachma which I had lost.’

block.text: Tapanda öz rәfiqәlәrini vә qonşularını çağırıb deyәr: “Mәnimlә birlikdә sevinin, itirdiyim dirhәmi tapmışam!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so, I tell you, there is joy in the presence of the angels of God over one sinner repenting.”

block.text: Sizә bunu deyirәm: Allahın mәlәklәrinin önündә dә tövbә edәn bir günahkara görә sevinc olur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: İsa bunu da danışdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain man had two sons.
The younger of them said to his father, ‘Father, give me my share of your property.’ He divided his livelihood between them.

block.text: <<Bir adamın iki oğlu var idi.
Oğlanlardan kiçiyi atasına dedi: “Ata! Var-dövlәtindәn payıma düşәni mәnә ver”. Atası da varını onların arasında bölüşdürdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not many days after, the younger son gathered all of this together and traveled into a far country. There he wasted his property with riotous living.

block.text: Bir neçә gün sonra kiçik oğul nәyi vardısa, yığıb uzaq bir diyara yollandı. Orada pozğun hәyat sürüb var-dövlәtini heç-puç etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had spent all of it, there arose a severe famine in that country, and he began to be in need.

block.text: Oğlan hәr şeyini xәrclәdikdәn sonra o ölkәdә böyük bir aclıq oldu. O korluq çәkmәyә başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went and joined himself to one of the citizens of that country, and he sent him into his fields to feed pigs.

block.text: Buna görә dә oğlan gedib o ölkәnin sakinlәrindәn birinin yanında iş tapdı. Bu adam onu öz otlaqlarına donuz otarmağa göndәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He wanted to fill his belly with the husks that the pigs ate, but no one gave him any.

block.text: Donuzların yediyi keçibuynuzu qabıqları ilә qarnını doydurmağa şad olardı. Amma heç kim ona bir şey vermirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he came to himself he said, ‘How many hired servants of my father's have bread enough to spare, and I'm dying with hunger!

block.text: Onda oğlan özünә gәlib dedi: “Atamın nә qәdәr muzdlu işçisi var, hamısının da doyunca yemәyә çörәyi var. Mәn isә burada acından ölürәm!

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will get up and go to my father, and will tell him, Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight.

block.text: Durub atamın yanına gedәcәyәm vә ona deyәcәyәm: ‹Ata, mәn göyә vә sәnә qarşı günah etdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I am no more worthy to be called your son. Make me as one of your hired servants.’”

block.text: Mәn artıq sәnin oğlun adlanmağa layiq deyilәm. Mәni öz muzdlu işçilәrinin biri kimi qәbul et›”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He arose, and came to his father. But while he was still far off, his father saw him, and was moved with compassion, and ran, and fell on his neck, and kissed him.

block.text: <<O durub öz atasının yanına getdi. Oğul hәlә uzaqda ikәn atası onu gördü. Ona rәhmi gәldi vә qaçıb onun boynuna sarıldı vә öpdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The son said to him, ‘Father, I have sinned against heaven, and in your sight. I am no longer worthy to be called your son.’”

block.text: Oğul dedi: “Ata! Mәn göyә vә sәnә qarşı günah etdim. Mәn artıq sәnin oğlun adlanmağa layiq deyilәm”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But the father said to his servants, ‘Bring out the best robe, and put it on him. Put a ring on his hand, and shoes on his feet.

block.text: <<Atası isә öz qullarına dedi: “Tez olun, әn gözәl xalat gәtirin vә onu geyindirin. Barmağına üzük vә ayaqlarına çarıq taxın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Bring the fattened calf, kill it, and let us eat, and celebrate;

block.text: Kökәldilmiş dananı gәtirin, kәsin: gәlin yeyib-şadlanaq!

ReferenceBlocks.text: for this, my son, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’ They began to celebrate.”

block.text: Çünki bu oğlum ölmüşdü, yenә hәyata qayıtdı. O itmişdi, tapıldı”. Belәliklә, şadlıq etmәyә başladılar.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now his elder son was in the field. As he came near to the house, he heard music and dancing.

block.text: <<Atanın böyük oğlu isә tarlada idi. Qayıdaraq evә yaxınlaşanda çalğı vә rәqs sәslәri eşitdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called one of the servants to him, and asked what was going on.

block.text: O, nökәrlәrdәn birini yanına çağırıb soruşdu: “Bu nәdir?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him, ‘Your brother has come, and your father has killed the fattened calf, because he has received him back safe and healthy.’

block.text: Nökәr ona dedi: “Qardaşın qayıdıb. Atan da onun sağ-salamat qayıtmasına görә kökәldilmiş dananı kәsib”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he was angry, and would not go in. Therefore his father came out, and begged him.

block.text: Böyük oğul isә hirslәndi vә içәri girmәk istәmәdi. Atası bayıra çıxıb ona yalvardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered his father, ‘Behold, these many years I have served you, and I never disobeyed a commandment of yours, but you never gave me a goat, that I might celebrate with my friends.

block.text: Amma o, atasına belә cavab verdi: “Bax neçә ildir ki, sәnin üçün qul kimi işlәyirәm. Heç zaman sәnin әmrindәn çıxmamışam. Amma mәnә bir oğlağı belә, heç vaxt qıymadın ki, dostlarımla şadlıq edim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when this, your son, came, who has devoured your living with prostitutes, you killed the fattened calf for him.’”

block.text: Bu oğlun isә sәnin bütün varını fahişә qadınlara sәrf edib. Amma o qayıdanda sәn onun üçün kökәldilmiş dananı kәsdin”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to him, ‘Son, you are always with me, and all that is mine is yours.

block.text: <<Atası isә ona dedi: “Oğlum, axı sәn hәmişә mәnimlәsәn vә bütün varım sәnindir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But it was appropriate to celebrate and be glad, for this, your brother, was dead, and is alive again. He was lost, and is found.’”

block.text: Lakin sevinmәk vә şadlanmaq lazımdır. Çünki sәnin bu qardaşın ölmüşdü, hәyata qayıtdı. O itmişdi, tapıldı!”>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 16
Jesus told his disciples,

block.text: İsa şagirdlәrә bunları danışdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There was a certain rich man who had a manager. An accusation was made to him that this man was wasting his possessions.

block.text: <<Varlı bir adamın idarәçisi var idi. Ona xәbәr çatdırıldı ki, idarәçi onun әmlakını israf edir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called him, and said to him, ‘What is this that I hear about you? Give an accounting of your management, for you can no longer be manager.’”

block.text: Varlı adam onu yanına çağırıb dedi: “Bu nәdir, sәnin haqqında mәn nәlәr eşidirәm? Mәnә idarәçiliyinin hesabatını ver. Sәn artıq idarәçi ola bilmәzsәn”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The manager said within himself, ‘What will I do, seeing that my lord is taking away the management position from me? I don't have strength to dig. I am ashamed to beg.

block.text: İdarәçi öz-özünә dedi: “Mәn nә edәcәyәm? Ağam idarәçiliyi әlimdәn alır. Torpaq bellәmәyә gücüm yoxdur, dilәnmәkdәn dә utanıram.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I know what I will do, so that when I am removed from management, they may receive me into their houses.’

block.text: İşdәn qovulanda mәni öz evlәrinә qәbul etsinlәr deyә nә edәcәyimi bilirәm”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Calling each one of his lord's debtors to him, he said to the first, ‘How much do you owe to my lord?’

block.text: Ona görә dә öz ağasına borclu olanları bir-bir çağırıb birincisinә dedi: “Mәnim ağama nә qәdәr borclusan?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said, ‘A hundred batos of oil.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and sit down quickly and write fifty.’

block.text: O “yüz bat zeytun yağı” dedi. İdarәçi ona dedi: “Öz qәbzini götür, otur vә tez yaz: әlli”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to another, ‘How much do you owe?’ He said, ‘A hundred cors of wheat.’ He said to him, ‘Take your bill, and write eighty.’”

block.text: Sonra o birisinә dedi: “Bәs sәnin nә qәdәr borcun var?” O cavab verdi: “Yüz kor buğda”. İdarәçi ona dedi: “Öz qәbzini götür vә yaz: sәksәn”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “His lord commended the dishonest manager because he had done wisely, for the children of this world are, in their own generation, wiser than the children of the light.

block.text: <<Ağası haqsızlıq edәn idarәçini fәrasәtli hәrәkәt etdiyinә görә tәriflәdi. Çünki bu dövrün övladları öz nәsillәri ilә münasibәtlәrindә nur övladlarından daha fәrasәtlidir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, make for yourselves friends by means of unrighteous mammon, so that when you fail, they may receive you into the eternal tents.

block.text: Mәn sizә bunu deyirәm: haqsız qazanc olan sәrvәtlә özünüzә dostlar qazanın ki, bu sәrvәt yox olduqda siz әbәdi mәskәnlәrә qәbul olunasınız.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who is faithful in a very little is faithful also in much. He who is dishonest in a very little is also dishonest in much.

block.text: Әn balaca bir işdә sadiq olan kәs böyük işdә dә sadiqdir, әn balaca bir işdә haqsız olan isә böyük işdә dә haqsızdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore you have not been faithful in the unrighteous mammon, who will commit to your trust the true riches?

block.text: Belәliklә, әgәr siz haqsız sәrvәtdәn istifadә etmәkdә sadiq olmadınızsa, әsl var-dövlәti sizә kim әmanәt edәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you have not been faithful in that which is another's, who will give you that which is your own?

block.text: Әgәr başqasının malından istifadә etmәkdә sadiq olmadınızsa, öz malınızı sizә kim verәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: No servant can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one, and love the other; or else he will hold to one, and despise the other. You aren't able to serve God and mammon.”

block.text: Heç bir nökәr iki ağaya qulluq edә bilmәz. Çünki ya birinә nifrәt edib o birisini sevәcәk ya da birinә bağlı qalıb o birisinә isә xor baxacaq. Siz hәm Allaha, hәm dә sәrvәtә qulluq edә bilmәzsiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees, who were lovers of money, also heard all these things, and they scoffed at him.

block.text: Fariseylәr pulpәrәst olduğu üçün bütün bu sözlәri eşidib İsaya istehza ilә baxdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa da onlara belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are those who justify yourselves in the sight of men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.

block.text: <<İnsanların qarşısında özünüzü saleh göstәrәn sizsiniz, amma Allah sizin ürәyinizi bilir. Çünki insanlar arasında uca tutulan şey Allah qarşısında iyrәnclikdir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The law and the prophets were until John. From that time the Good News of the Kingdom of God is preached, and everyone is forcing his way into it.

block.text: Qanun vә Peyğәmbәrlәr Yәhyanın gәlişinә qәdәr idi. O vaxtdan bәri Allahın Padşahlığının Müjdәsi yayılır vә hәr kәs oraya zorla girmәyә çalışır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But it is easier for heaven and earth to pass away, than for one tiny stroke of a pen in the law to fall.

block.text: Amma göyün vә yerin keçib getmәsi Qanundan bir nöqtәnin düşmәsindәn daha asandır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery. He who marries one who is divorced from a husband commits adultery.”

block.text: Arvadını boşayıb başqası ilә evlәnәn hәr kәs zina edir. Әrindәn boşanmış qadınla evlәnәn dә zina edir.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Now there was a certain rich man, and he was clothed in purple and fine linen, living in luxury every day.

block.text: Varlı bir adam var idi. O, tünd qırmızı vә incә kәtandan paltar geyәrdi vә hәr gün cah-calal içindә kef edәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain beggar, named Lazarus, was laid at his gate, full of sores.

block.text: Bütün bәdәni yaralı olan Lazar adlı yoxsul bir adam da var idi. O, varlı adamın qapısı ağzına gәtirilib uzanmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was desiring to be fed with the crumbs that fell from the rich man's table. Yes, even the dogs came and licked his sores.

block.text: Lazar varlı adamın süfrәsindәn tökülәn qırıntılarla qarnını doydurmaq arzusunda idi. İtlәr dә gәlib onun yaralarını yalayırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that the beggar died, and that he was carried away by the angels to Abraham's bosom. The rich man also died, and was buried.

block.text: Bir gün yoxsul adam öldü vә mәlәklәr onu İbrahimin qucağına apardı. Varlı adam da öldü vә dәfn edildi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In Hades, he lifted up his eyes, being in torment, and saw Abraham far off, and Lazarus at his bosom.

block.text: Varlı adam ölülәr diyarında iztirab çәkәndә gözlәrini qaldırıb uzaqda İbrahimi vә onun qucağında Lazarı gördü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He cried and said, ‘Father Abraham, have mercy on me, and send Lazarus, that he may dip the tip of his finger in water, and cool my tongue! For I am in anguish in this flame.’”

block.text: O uca sәslә dedi: “Ey İbrahim ata, mәnә rәhm et! Lazarı göndәr, barmağının ucunu suya batırıb mәnim dilimi sәrinlәtsin, çünki mәn bu alov içindә әzab çәkirәm”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But Abraham said, ‘Son, remember that you, in your lifetime, received your good things, and Lazarus, in the same way, bad things. But now here he is comforted and you are in anguish.

block.text: <<Lakin İbrahim dedi: “Oğlum, yadına sal ki, sәn öz hәyatında yaxşı şeylәri, Lazar isә pis şeylәri almışdır. İndi isә o, tәsәlli tapır, amma sәn әzab çәkirsәn.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Besides all this, between us and you there is a great gulf fixed, that those who want to pass from here to you are not able, and that none may cross over from there to us.’”

block.text: Üstәlik, sizinlә bizim aramıza böyük bir uçurum qoyulmuşdur ki, nә buradan sizin tәrәfinizә keçmәk istәyәnlәr keçә bilir, nә dә oradan bizim yanımıza gәlә bilirlәr”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said, ‘I ask you therefore, father, that you would send him to my father's house.

block.text: <<Varlı adam dedi: “Ata, elә isә yalvarıram sәnә, Lazarı atamın evinә göndәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I have five brothers. Let him testify to them so that they won't also come into this place of torment.’”

block.text: Çünki beş qardaşım var. Qoy onlara xәbәrdarlıq etsin ki, onlar da bu iztirab yerinә gәlmәsinlәr”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But Abraham said to him, ‘They have Moses and the prophets. Let them listen to them.’”

block.text: İbrahim ona dedi: “Onlarda Musanın vә Peyğәmbәrlәrin sözlәri var. Qoy onlara qulaq assınlar”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said, ‘No, father Abraham, but if one goes to them from the dead, they will repent.’”

block.text: Varlı adam isә dedi: “Xeyr, İbrahim ata! Әgәr ölülәrdәn biri onların yanına gәlsә, onlar tövbә edәrlәr”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to him, ‘If they don't listen to Moses and the prophets, neither will they be persuaded if one rises from the dead.’”

block.text: Onda İbrahim ona dedi: “Әgәr onlar Musaya vә Peyğәmbәrlәrә qulaq asmırlarsa, ölülәrdәn biri dirilsә belә, inanmazlar”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 17
He said to the disciples,

block.text: İsa şagirdlәrinә belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is impossible that no occasions of stumbling should come, but woe to him through whom they come!

block.text: <<İnsanları pis yola çәkәn şeylәr mütlәq olur. Amma vay o adamın halına ki, bunların baisidir!

ReferenceBlocks.text: It would be better for him if a millstone were hung around his neck, and he were thrown into the sea, rather than that he should cause one of these little ones to stumble.

block.text: Bu kiçiklәrdәn birini pis yola çәkmәkdәnsә öz boynuna böyük bir dәyirman daşı asıb dәnizә atılmaq onun üçün daha yaxşı olar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Be careful. If your brother sins against you, rebuke him. If he repents, forgive him.

block.text: Özünüzә fikir verin. Әgәr qardaşın sәnә qarşı günah edәrsә, ona xәbәrdarlıq et. Әgәr o tövbә edәrsә, onu bağışla.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If he sins against you seven times in the day, and seven times returns, saying, ‘I repent,’ you shall forgive him.”

block.text: Әgәr gündә yeddi dәfә sәnә qarşı günah etsә vә gündә yeddi dәfә yanına gәlib sәnә “tövbә edirәm” deyәrsә, onu bağışla>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The apostles said to the Lord,

block.text: Hәvarilәr Rәbbә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Increase our faith.”

block.text: <<İmanımızı artır!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: Rәbb onlara belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you would tell this sycamore tree, ‘Be uprooted, and be planted in the sea,’ and it would obey you.

block.text: <<Bir xardal toxumu qәdәr imanınız olsaydı, bu tut ağacına “Kökündәn çıx vә dәnizdә әkil!” deyәrdiniz, o da sizin sözünüzә baxardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But who is there among you, having a servant plowing or keeping sheep, that will say, when he comes in from the field, ‘Come immediately and sit down at the table,’

block.text: Sizlәrdәn hansı biriniz cütçülük vә yaxud çobanlıq edәn bir qula tarladan qayıdanda “tez ol, gәl süfrәyә otur” deyәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: and will not rather tell him, ‘Prepare my supper, clothe yourself properly, and serve me, while I eat and drink. Afterward you shall eat and drink’?

block.text: Әksinә, ona “axşam yemәyimi hazırla vә qurşanıb mәnә xidmәt et ki, mәn yeyib-içim, sonra da sәn özün ye-iç” demәzmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Does he thank that servant because he did the things that were commanded? I think not.

block.text: Onun әmrlәrini yerinә yetirdiyi üçün o, qula tәşәkkür edәrmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so you also, when you have done all the things that are commanded you, say, ‘We are unworthy servants. We have done our duty.’”

block.text: Belәcә siz dә sizә әmr olunanların hamısını yerinә yetirәndәn sonra deyin: “Biz dәyәrsiz qullarıq, çünki görmәli olduğumuz işlәri etmişik”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened as he was on his way to Jerusalem, that he was passing along the borders of Samaria and Galilee.

block.text: İsa Yerusәlimә doğru yolunu davam edәrkәn Samariya ilә Qalileya arasındakı sәrhәddәn keçirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he entered into a certain village, ten men who were lepers met him, who stood at a distance.

block.text: Kәndlәrin birinә girәndә Onu on nәfәr cüzamlı kişi qarşıladı. Onlar uzaqda durub

ReferenceBlocks.text: They lifted up their voices, saying,

block.text: ucadan çığırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus, Master, have mercy on us!”

block.text: <<İsa, Ustad, bizә rәhm et!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he saw them, he said to them,

block.text: İsa onları görüb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and show yourselves to the priests.”

block.text: <<Gedin, özünüzü kahinlәrә göstәrin>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that as they went, they were cleansed.

block.text: Onlar yol gedә-gedә pak oldular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of them, when he saw that he was healed, turned back. Glorifying God with a loud voice he said:

block.text: Onlardan biri, o zaman ki, o, şəfa gördüm, dönüb. Mədh Allah qışqıra-qışqıra ilə dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Glory be to God!”

block.text: "Şöhrət Allah olsun!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He fell on his face at Jesus’ feet, giving him thanks; and he was a Samaritan.
Jesus answered,

block.text: O üzüstә İsanın ayaqlarına düşәrәk Ona tәşәkkür etdi. Bu adam Samariyalı idi.
Onda İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Weren't the ten cleansed? But where are the nine?

block.text: <<Pak olanlar on nәfәr deyildimi? Bәs qalan doqquz adam haradadır?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Were there none found who returned to give glory to God, except this stranger?”

block.text: Bu yadellidәn savayı geri dönüb Allaha izzәt verәn olmadımı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to him,

block.text: Sonra o adama dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get up, and go your way. Your faith has healed you.”

block.text: <<Ayağa qalx, get. İmanın sәni xilas etdi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisees asked him,

block.text: Fariseylәr İsadan

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When will the Kingdom of God come?”

block.text: <<Allahın Padşahlığı nә zaman gәlәcәk?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: soruşanda İsa onlara cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of God doesn't come with observation;

block.text: <<Allahın Padşahlığı müşahidә ilә gәlmәz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: neither will they say, ‘Look, here!’ or, ‘Look, there!’ for behold, the Kingdom of God is within you.”

block.text: Adamlar “bax, o buradadır” yaxud “oradadır” demәyәcәklәr, çünki budur, Allahın Padşahlığı sizin daxilinizdәdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to the disciples,

block.text: İsa şagirdlәrә dә belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The days will come, when you will desire to see one of the days of the Son of Man, and you will not see it.

block.text: <<Elә günlәr gәlәcәk ki, Bәşәr Oğlunun günlәrindәn birini görmәyi arzulayacaqsınız, amma görmәyәcәksiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will tell you, ‘Look, he is here!’ or ‘Look, he is there!’ Don't follow after them.

block.text: Adamlar sizә “bax, O oradadır” yaxud “bax, buradadır” deyәcәk. Gedib onların arxasınca düşmәyin!

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Son of Man comes, he will be like the flash of lighning that shines from one end of the sky to the other.

block.text: Çünki şimşәk göyün bir kәnarında çaxıb o biri kәnarına qәdәr necә parlayırsa, Bәşәr Oğlu da Öz günündә elә olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But first, he must suffer many things and be rejected by this generation.

block.text: Amma әvvәlcә O, çox әzab çәkmәli vә indiki nәslin adamları tәrәfindәn rәdd olunmalıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As it happened in the days of Noah, even so will it be also in the days of the Son of Man.

block.text: Nuhun günlәrindә necә idisә, Bәşәr Oğlunun günlәrindә dә elә olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They ate, they drank, they married, they were given in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ship, and the flood came, and destroyed them all.

block.text: Nuhun gәmiyә girdiyi günә qәdәr insanlar yeyib-içir, evlәnir, әrә gedirdi. Sonra daşqın gәlib hamısını mәhv etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Likewise, even as it happened in the days of Lot: they ate, they drank, they bought, they sold, they planted, they built;

block.text: Lutun günlәrindә dә belә idi: insanlar yeyib-içir, alıb-satır, әkir, tikirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but in the day that Lot went out from Sodom, it rained fire and sulfur from the sky, and destroyed them all.

block.text: Lakin Lut Sodomdan çıxdığı gün göydәn od vә kükürd yağdı vә hamısını mәhv etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It will be the same way in the day that the Son of Man is revealed.

block.text: Bәşәr Oğlunun zühur edәcәyi gündә dә belә olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In that day, he who will be on the housetop, and his goods in the house, let him not go down to take them away. Let him who is in the field likewise not turn back.
Remember Lot's wife!

block.text: O gündә özü damda, әşyası isә evin içindә olan adam onları götürmәk üçün aşağı enmәsin. Elәcә dә tarlada olan geri qayıtmasın.
Lutun arvadını yadınıza salın!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever seeks to save his life loses it, but whoever loses his life preserves it.

block.text: Kim canını qorumaq istәsә, onu itirәcәk, amma kim canını itirsә, onu yaşadacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, in that night there will be two people in one bed. The one will be taken, and the other will be left.

block.text: Sizә deyirәm: o gecә bir yataqda olan iki nәfәrdәn biri götürülәcәk, o birisi isә qalacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be two grinding grain together. One will be taken, and the other will be left.

block.text: Birlikdә dәn üyüdәn iki qadından biri götürülәcәk, o birisi isә qalacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Two men will be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.”

block.text: Two men will be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They, answering, asked him,

block.text: Ona müraciәt edib dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where, Lord?”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, bu hadisәlәr harada olacaq?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: O isә onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where the dead body is, there will the vultures also be gathered together.”

block.text: <<Leş haradadırsa, kәrkәslәr dә orada toplaşar>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 18
He also spoke a parable to them that they must always pray, and not give up,
saying,

block.text: İsa şagirdlәrinә daim dua etmәk vә heç ruhdan düşmәmәk lazım olduğu barәdә bir mәsәl çәkdi.
O dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “There was a judge in a certain city who didn't fear God, and didn't respect man.

block.text: <<Bir şәhәrdә Allahdan qorxmayan vә adamlara hörmәt etmәyәn bir hakim var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A widow was in that city, and she often came to him, saying, ‘Defend me from my adversary!’

block.text: Elә hәmin şәhәrdә bir dul qadın da var idi. Qadın hey onun yanına gәlәrәk deyәrdi: “Rәqibimlә olan işimdә mәnim haqqımı qoru”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He wouldn't for a while, but afterward he said to himself, ‘It is true that I neither fear God, nor respect man.

block.text: Amma hakim bir müddәt bunu etmәk istәmәdi, sonra isә öz-özünә dedi: “Hәrçәnd mәn nә Allahdan qorxur, nә dә adamlara hörmәt edirәm,

ReferenceBlocks.text: However, because this widow keeps bothering me, I will defend her, or else she will wear me out by her continual coming.’”

block.text: bu qadın mәnim zәhlәmi tökdüyü üçün onun haqqını qoruyum ki, o bir dә gәlib baş-qulağımı aparmasın”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: Rәbb sözünә belә davam etdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Listen to what the unrighteous judge says.

block.text: <<Әdalәtsiz hakimin nә dediyini dinlәyin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Won't God avenge his chosen ones, who are crying out to him day and night, and yet he exercises patience with them?

block.text: Mәgәr Allah Öz seçdiklәrini, gecә-gündüz Ondan imdad istәyәnlәrin haqqını qorumayacaqmı? Onları çox gözlәdәcәkmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that he will avenge them quickly. Nevertheless, when the Son of Man comes, will he find faith on the earth?”

block.text: Sizә bunu deyirәm: tezliklә onların haqqını qoruyacaq. Bәs Bәşәr Oğlu gәlәndә yer üzündә iman tapacaqmı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke also this parable to certain people who were convinced of their own righteousness, and who despised all others.

block.text: Özlәrinin saleh olduğuna güvәnib başqalarına xor baxan bәzilәri üçün dә İsa belә bir mәsәl çәkdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Two men went up into the temple to pray; one was a Pharisee, and the other was a tax collector.

block.text: <<Biri farisey, digәri isә vergiyığan olan iki nәfәr dua etmәk üçün mәbәdә girdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Pharisee stood and prayed to himself like this: ‘God, I thank you, that I am not like the rest of men, extortioners, unrighteous, adulterers, or even like this tax collector.

block.text: Farisey ayaq üstә durub öz-özünә belә dua edirdi: “Ya Allah, Sәnә şükürlәr olsun ki, mәn başqaları kimi soyğunçu, haqsız, zinakar ya da bu vergiyığan kimi deyilәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I fast twice a week. I give tithes of all that I get.’

block.text: Hәftәdә iki dәfә oruc tuturam, bütün qazandığımın onda birini verirәm”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the tax collector, standing far away, wouldn't even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, ‘God, be merciful to me, a sinner!’

block.text: Vergiyığan isә uzaqda durub gözlәrini göyә qaldırmağa belә, cәsarәt etmirdi, amma sinәsinә vurub hey deyirdi: “Ya Allah! Mәn günahkara rәhm et!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, this man went down to his house justified rather than the other; for everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be exalted.”

block.text: Sizә deyirәm ki, o farisey yox, vergiyığan evinә saleh sayılaraq getdi. Çünki özünü yüksәldәn hәr kәs aşağı tutulacaq, özünü aşağı tutansa yüksәldilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were also bringing their babies to him, that he might touch them. But when the disciples saw it, they said:

block.text: Adamlar körpәlәri dә İsanın yanına gәtirirdilәr ki, İsa onlara toxunsun. Lakin o zaman həvarilər gördükdə dedilər:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not bother the teacher!”

block.text: "Müəllim üzen etmə!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus summoned them, saying,

block.text: Amma İsa uşaqları yanına çağırıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow the little children to come to me, and don't hinder them, for the Kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

block.text: <<Uşaqları buraxın, qoy Mәnim yanıma gәlsinlәr! Onlara mane olmayın! Çünki Allahın Padşahlığı belәlәrinә mәxsusdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly, I tell you, whoever doesn't receive the Kingdom of God like a little child, he will in no way enter into it.”

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: kim Allahın Padşahlığını bir uşaq kimi qәbul etmәsә, oraya әsla daxil ola bilmәz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain ruler asked him, saying,

block.text: Rәhbәrlәrdәn biri İsadan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Good Teacher, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?”

block.text: <<Ey yaxşı Müәllim, mәn nә etmәliyәm ki, әbәdi hәyatı irs olaraq alım?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus asked him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you call me good? No one is good, except one--God.

block.text: <<Mәnә niyә yaxşı deyirsәn? Tәk Allahdan başqa yaxşısı yoxdur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You know the commandments: ‘Don't commit adultery,’ ‘Don't murder,’ ‘Don't steal,’ ‘Don't give false testimony,’ ‘Honor your father and your mother.’”

block.text: Onun әmrlәrini bilirsәn: “Zina etmә. Qәtl etmә. Oğurluq etmә. Yalandan şahidlik etmә. Ata-anana hörmәt et”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Bu adam isә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have observed all these things from my youth up.”

block.text: <<Bunların hamısına gәncliyimdәn bәri riayәt edirәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard these things, he said to him,

block.text: İsa bunu eşidib ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You still lack one thing. Sell all that you have, and distribute it to the poor. You will have treasure in heaven. Come, follow me.”

block.text: <<Sәnin bir şeyin çatışmır: nәyin varsa, satıb yoxsullara payla. Onda göylәrdә xәzinәn olacaq. Sonra qayıt, Mәnim ardımca gәl>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he heard these things, he became very sad, for he was very rich.
Jesus, seeing that he became very sad, said,

block.text: Amma bu sözlәri eşitdikdә hәmin adamı dәrin kәdәr bürüdü, çünki çox varlı idi.
İsa onun dәrindәn kәdәrlәndiyini görәndә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “How hard it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!

block.text: <<Var-dövlәti olanların Allahın Padşahlığına daxil olması nә qәdәr çәtindir!

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it is easier for a camel to enter in through a needle's eye, than for a rich man to enter into the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Doğrudan da, dәvәnin iynә gözündәn keçmәsi varlı adamın Allahın Padşahlığına daxil olmasından asandır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who heard it said,

block.text: Bunları eşidәnlәr dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then who can be saved?”

block.text: <<Elә isә, kim xilas ola bilәr?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said,

block.text: O isә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.”

block.text: <<İnsan üçün qeyri-mümkün olan, Allah üçün mümkündür>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter said,

block.text: Peter isә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Look, we have left everything, and followed you.”

block.text: <<Bax biz hәr şeyi qoyub Sәnin ardınca gәlmişik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, there is no one who has left house, or wife, or brothers, or parents, or children, for the Kingdom of God's sake,
who will not receive many times more in this time, and in the world to come, eternal life.”

block.text: <<Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: Allahın Padşahlığı uğrunda ya evini ya arvadını ya bacı-qardaşlarını ya ata-anasını vә yaxud uşaqlarını atan elә bir kәs yoxdur ki,
bu dövrdә bundan neçә qat artıq, gәlәcәk dövrdә isә әbәdi hәyat almasın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took the twelve aside, and said to them,

block.text: İsa On İki şagirdi kәnara çәkib onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, we are going up to Jerusalem, and all the things that are written through the prophets concerning the Son of Man will be completed.

block.text: <<Bax Yerusәlimә qalxırıq, Bәşәr Oğlu üçün peyğәmbәrlәr vasitәsilә yazılanların hamısı tam yerinә yetәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For he will be delivered up to the Gentiles, will be mocked, treated shamefully, and spit on.

block.text: Çünki O, başqa millәtlәrә tәslim edilәcәk. Onlar Onu әlә salıb tәhqir edәcәk, Ona tüpürәcәk

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will scourge and kill him. On the third day, he will rise again.”

block.text: vә qamçılayıb öldürәcәklәr. O, üçüncü gün dirilәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They understood none of these things. This saying was hidden from them, and they didn't understand the things that were said.

block.text: Amma şagirdlәr bu sözlәrdәn heç bir şey başa düşmәdilәr. Bu sözlәr onlar üçün gizli saxlandı vә onlar deyilәnlәri anlamırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, as he came near Jericho, a certain blind man sat by the road, begging.

block.text: İsa Yerixoya yaxınlaşanda bir kor adam yol kәnarında oturub dilәnirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Hearing a multitude going by, he asked:

block.text: Yanından çoxlu adamın keçdiyini eşitdikdә soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What is going on?”

block.text: <<Nә olub?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him:

block.text: Ona xәbәr verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus of Nazareth is passing by.”

block.text: <<Nazaretli İsa buradan keçir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He cried out,

block.text: Onda o qışqırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Jesus, son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: <<Ey Davud Oğlu İsa! Mәnә rәhm elә!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who led the way rebuked him and said:

block.text: O kəslər ki, ona yol rəhbərlik töhmətlənmək və dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Be quiet!”

block.text: "Sakit olun!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: but he cried out all the more,

block.text: o deyә daha ucadan bağırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Son of David, have mercy on me!”

block.text: <<Ey Davud Oğlu! Mәnә rәhm elә!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Standing still, Jesus commanded him to be brought to him. When he had come near, he asked him,

block.text: İsa dayanıb әmr etdi ki, onu yanına gәtirsinlәr. Adam yaxınlaşarkәn İsa ondan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do you want me to do?”

block.text: <<Nә istәyirsәn, sәnin üçün edim?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: O dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, that I may see again.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, gözlәrim açılsın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Receive your sight. Your faith has healed you.”

block.text: <<Qoy gözlәrin açılsın, imanın sәni xilas etdi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately he received his sight and followed him, glorifying God, saying:

block.text: Dərhal onun yanında almış və ona tabe, Allah mədh edib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Glory be to God!”

block.text: "Şöhrət Allah olsun!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the people, when they saw it, praised God.

block.text: Bütün insanlara, onlar gördükdə, Allah vəsf.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 19
He entered and was passing through Jericho.

block.text: İsa Yerixoya daxil olub oradan keçirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There was a man named Zacchaeus. He was a chief tax collector, and he was rich.

block.text: Orada vergiyığanların rәisi olan Zakkay adlı varlı bir nәfәr var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was trying to see who Jesus was, and couldn't because of the crowd, because he was short.

block.text: İsanın kim olduğunu görmәyә can atırdı. Amma balacaboy olduğuna görә izdihamın arasından Onu görә bilmirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He ran on ahead, and climbed up into a sycamore tree to see him, for he was to pass that way.

block.text: İsanı görmәk üçün irәliyә qaçıb bir firon әnciri ağacına dırmaşdı. Çünki İsa oradan keçmәli idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus came to the place, he looked up and saw him, and said to him,

block.text: İsa o yerә çatdıqda yuxarı baxıb onu gördü vә ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Zacchaeus, hurry and come down, for today I must stay at your house.”

block.text: <<Ay Zakkay, tez aşağı düş. Bu gün Mәn sәnin evindә qalmalıyam>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He hurried, came down, and received him joyfully.

block.text: O tez aşağı düşüb İsanı sevinclә qәbul etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they saw it, they all murmured, saying,

block.text: Bütün xalq bunu gördükdә deyinәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He has gone in to lodge with a man who is a sinner.”

block.text: <<Gedib günahkar bir kişinin qonağı oldu!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Zacchaeus stood and said to the Lord,

block.text: Zakkay isә ayağa qalxıb Rәbbә belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, Lord, half of my goods I give to the poor. If I have wrongfully exacted anything of anyone, I restore four times as much.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, әmlakımın yarısını yoxsullara verәrәm vә kimdәn haqsızlıqla bir şey almışamsa, ona dördqat qaytaracağam>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Today, salvation has come to this house, because he also is a son of Abraham.

block.text: <<Bu gün bu evә xilas gәldi, çünki bu adam da İbrahimin oğludur.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man came to seek and to save that which was lost.”

block.text: Çünki Bәşәr Oğlu itmişlәri axtarıb xilas etmәk üçün gәlmişdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they heard these things, he went on and told a parable, because he was near Jerusalem, and they supposed that the Kingdom of God would be revealed immediately.
He said therefore,

block.text: Onlar bu şeylәri dinlәyәrkәn İsa bir mәsәl dә çәkdi. Çünki O, Yerusәlimә yaxınlaşmışdı vә onlar elә düşünürdülәr ki, Allahın Padşahlığı dәrhal üzә çıxacaq.
İsa belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A certain nobleman went into a far country to receive for himself a kingdom, and to return.

block.text: <<Әsilzadәlәrdәn olan bir nәfәr padşah tәyin olunub geri dönmәk üçün uzaq bir ölkәyә yola düşdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He called ten servants of his, and gave them ten mina coins, and told them, ‘Conduct business until I come.’

block.text: Getmәmişdәn әvvәl qullarından on nәfәri çağırdı vә onlara on mina pul verib dedi: “Mәn gәlәnәdәk bunlarla ticarәt et”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But his citizens hated him, and sent an envoy after him, saying, ‘We don't want this man to reign over us.’”

block.text: Lakin әhalisi ona nifrәt etdi vә onun ardınca elçilәr göndәrib dedi: “Bu adamın üzәrimizdә padşah olmasını istәmirik”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It happened when he had come back again, having received the kingdom, that he commanded these servants, to whom he had given the money, to be called to him, that he might know what they had gained by conducting business.

block.text: <<O, padşah tәyin olunub qayıdanda pul verdiyi hәmin qulları yanına çağırtdırdı vә nә qazandıqlarını öyrәnmәk istәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The first came before him, saying, ‘Lord, your mina has made ten more minas.’”

block.text: Birincisi gәlib dedi: “Ağa, sәnin bir minan on mina da qazandırdı”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to him, ‘Well done, you good servant! Because you were found faithful with very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.’”

block.text: Ağası ona dedi: “Afәrin, yaxşı qulum! Әn kiçik bir işdә mәnә sadiq olduğun üçün on şәhәrin idarәsini üzәrinә götür”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The second came, saying, ‘Your mina, Lord, has made five minas.’”

block.text: İkincisi gәlib dedi: “Ağa! Sәnin bir minan beş mina da qazandırdı”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “So he said to him, ‘And you are to be over five cities.’

block.text: Ağası ona da “sәn dә beş şәhәrә hakim ol” dedi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Another came, saying, ‘Lord, behold, your mina, which I kept laid away in a handkerchief

block.text: Bir başqası gәlib dedi: “Ağa! Budur sәnin minan, onu dәsmala büküb saxlayırdım.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I was afraid of you because you are an exacting man. You take up that which you didn't lay down, and reap that which you didn't sow.’”

block.text: Çünki sәndәn qorxurdum, sәn qәddar bir adamsan, özün qoymadığını götürürsәn vә özün әkmәdiyini biçirsәn”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to him, ‘Out of your own mouth will I judge you, you wicked servant! You knew that I am an exacting man, taking up that which I didn't lay down, and reaping that which I didn't sow.

block.text: <<Ağası ona dedi: “Ay pis qul, sәni öz ağzından çıxan sözlәrlә mühakimә edәcәyәm! Mәnim qәddar bir adam olduğumu, özüm qoymadığımı götürdüyümü vә özüm әkmәdiyimi biçdiyimi bilirdinmi?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then why didn't you deposit my money in the bank, and at my coming, I might have earned interest on it?’

block.text: Bәs onda nә üçün mәnim pulumu sәrraflara vermәdin ki, mәn qayıdanda onu faizlә geri alım?”

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to those who stood by, ‘Take the mina away from him, and give it to him who has the ten minas.’”

block.text: Sonra әtrafında olanlara dedi: “Әlindәki minanı ondan alın vә on minası olana verin!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They said to him, ‘Lord, he has ten minas!’

block.text: Ona dedilәr: “Ay ağa, axı artıq onun on minası var!”

ReferenceBlocks.text: He replied to them, ‘I tell you that to everyone who has, will more be given; but from him who doesn't have, even that which he has will be taken away.

block.text: O, sözünә belә davam etdi: “Sizә deyirәm: kimin varıdırsa, daha çox verilәcәk, kimin yoxudursa, әlindә olan da alınacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But bring those enemies of mine who didn't want me to reign over them here, and kill them before me.’”

block.text: Mәnim onların padşahı olmağımı istәmәyәn düşmәnlәrimi isә buraya gәtirin vә mәnim gözümün qabağında qılıncdan keçirin!”>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having said these things, he went on ahead, going up to Jerusalem.

block.text: İsa bu sözlәri deyib qabaqda yeriyәrәk Yerusәlimә doğru qalxdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, when he drew near to Bethsphage and Bethany, at the mountain that is called Olivet, he sent two of his disciples,
saying,

block.text: Zeytun dağı adlanan dağın yamacındakı Bet-Faqe ilә Bet-Anyaya yaxınlaşarkәn şagirdlәrdәn ikisini göndәrәrәk
dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way into the village on the other side, in which, as you enter, you will find a colt tied, whereon no man ever yet sat. Untie it, and bring it.

block.text: <<Qarşınızdakı kәndә gedin. Oraya girәndә hәlә heç kәsin minmәdiyi, bağlanmış bir sıpa tapacaqsınız. Onu açıb buraya gәtirin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone asks you, ‘Why are you untying it?’ say to him: ‘The Lord needs it.’”

block.text: Kim sizdәn soruşsa: “Nә üçün sıpanı açırsınız?”, ona “bu sıpa Rәbbә lazımdır” deyәrsiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were sent went away, and found things just as he had told them.

block.text: Göndәrilәnlәr gedib hәr şeyin Onun dediyi kimi olduğunu gördülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they were untying the colt, its owners said to them,

block.text: Onlar sıpanı açanda onun sahiblәri onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why are you untying the colt?”

block.text: <<Bu sıpanı nә üçün açırsınız?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Onlar cavab verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord needs it.”

block.text: <<Bu sıpa Rәbbә lazımdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They brought it to Jesus. They threw their cloaks on the colt, and set Jesus on them.

block.text: Sıpanı İsanın yanına gәtirdilәr vә öz paltarlarını sıpanın üstünә sәrib İsanı onun belinә mindirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he went, they spread their cloaks in the way.

block.text: O irәli gedәrkәn insanlar öz paltarlarını yola döşәyirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As he was now getting near, at the descent of the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began to rejoice and praise God with a loud voice for all the mighty works which they had seen,
saying,

block.text: İsa Zeytun dağının aşağı düşәn yamacına yaxınlaşanda çoxlu şagird gördüklәri bütün möcüzәlәr üçün sevinib uca sәslә Allaha hәmd etmәyә başladı.
Onlar deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest!”

block.text: <<Rәbbin ismi ilә gәlәn Padşaha alqış olsun! Göydә sülh, әn ucalarda izzәt olsun!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the Pharisees from the multitude said to him,

block.text: İzdihamın arasından bәzi fariseylәr Ona dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, rebuke your disciples!”

block.text: <<Müәllim, şagirdlәrinә qadağan et!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Lakin İsa cavabında onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you that if these were silent, the stones would cry out.”

block.text: <<Sizә bunu deyirәm ki, әgәr onlar sussa, daşlar dilә gәlәr!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he drew near, he saw the city and wept over it,
saying,

block.text: İsa Yerusәlimә yaxınlaşanda ona baxıb şәhәr üçün ağladı.
O dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you, even you, had known today the things which belong to your peace! But now, they are hidden from your eyes.

block.text: <<Ah, kaş sәn dә bu gün sülhә aparan yolu tanıyaydın! Amma bu yol hәlәlik sәnin nәzәrindәn gizlәnib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the days will come on you, when your enemies will throw up a barricade against you, surround you, hem you in on every side.

block.text: Çünki sәni elә günlәr gözlәyir ki, düşmәnlәrin sәni sәdlә әhatә edәcәk, mühasirәyә alacaq vә hәr yerdәn sıxışdıracaqlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will dash you and your children within you to the ground. They will not leave in you one stone on another, because you didn't know the time of your visitation.”

block.text: Sәni dә, qucağındakı övladlarını da yerlә yeksan edәcәklәr. Daşını daş üstә qoymayacaqlar, çünki Allahın sәnә yaxınlaşdığı zamanı anlamadın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He entered into the temple, and began to drive out those who bought and sold in it,
saying to them,

block.text: İsa mәbәdә girib orada satıcılıq edәnlәri qovmağa başladı.
Onlara belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is written, ‘My house is a house of prayer,’ but you have made it a ‘den of robbers’!”

block.text: <<“Mәnim evim dua evi olacaq” deyә yazılıb. Amma siz onu quldur yuvasına çevirmisiniz!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was teaching daily in the temple, but the chief priests and the scribes and the leading men among the people sought to destroy him.
