block.text: İsa hәr gün mәbәddә tәlim öyrәdirdi. Başçı kahinlәr, ilahiyyatçılar vә xalqın nüfuzlu adamları Onu öldürmәk üçün yol axtarırdı,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They couldn't find what they might do, for all the people hung on to every word that he said.

block.text: amma bunu necә edәcәklәrini bilmirdilәr. Çünki bütün xalq Onu böyük diqqәtlә dinlәyirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 20
It happened on one of those days, as he was teaching the people in the temple and preaching the Good News, that the priests and scribes came to him with the elders.
They asked him,

block.text: Günlәrin birindә İsa mәbәddә xalqa tәlim öyrәdirdi vә Müjdәni yayırdı. Başçı kahinlәr, ilahiyyatçılarla ağsaqqallar yaxınlaşıb
Ona dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Tell us: by what authority do you do these things? Or who is giving you this authority?”

block.text: <<De görәk, Sәn bu işlәri hansı sәlahiyyәtlә edirsәn? Sәnә bu sәlahiyyәti kim verib?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: İsa onlara belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I also will ask you one question. Tell me:
the baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men?”

block.text: <<Mәn dә sizә bir sual verәcәyәm. Mәnә deyin:
Yәhyanın vәftizi göydәn idimi, yoxsa insanlardan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They reasoned with themselves, saying,

block.text: Onlarsa öz aralarında müzakirә edәrәk belә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If we say, ‘From heaven,’ he will say, ‘Why didn't you believe him?’

block.text: <<Әgәr desәk “göydәn”, “Bәs nә üçün ona inanmadınız?” deyәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if we say, ‘From men,’ all the people will stone us, for they are persuaded that John was a prophet.”

block.text: Amma desәk “insanlardan”, bütün xalq bizi daşqalaq edәr. Çünki xalq Yәhyanın peyğәmbәr olmasına әmindir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered, saying:

block.text: Axırda Ona cavab verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We don't know.”

block.text: <<Biz bilmirik haradandır.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa da onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Neither will I tell you by what authority I do these things.”

block.text: <<Bunları hansı sәlahiyyәtlә etdiyimi Mәn dә sizә demirәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He began to tell the people this parable.

block.text: İsa xalqa belә bir mәsәl çәkmәyә başladı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A man planted a vineyard, and rented it out to some farmers, and went into another country for a long time.

block.text: <<Bir adam üzüm bağı saldı vә bağı bağbanlara icarәyә verәrәk uzun müddәtә başqa ölkәyә getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: At the proper season, he sent a servant to the farmers to collect his share of the fruit of the vineyard. But the farmers beat him, and sent him away empty.

block.text: Mәhsul vaxtı çatanda bağbanların yanına bir qul göndәrdi ki, onlar üzüm bağının mәhsulundan bir qәdәrini ona versinlәr. Lakin bağbanlar qulu döyәrәk әliboş geri qaytardılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent yet another servant, and they also beat him, and treated him shamefully, and sent him away empty.

block.text: Bağ sahibi başqa bir qul göndәrdi, amma onlar bunu da döyüb biabır etdilәr vә әliboş geri qaytardılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent yet a third, and they also wounded him, and threw him out.

block.text: O, üçüncüsünü dә göndәrdi, amma onlar onu da yaralayıb qovdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The lord of the vineyard said, ‘What shall I do? I will send my beloved son. It may be that seeing him, they will respect him.’”

block.text: Onda bağ sahibi dedi: “Mәn nә edim? Qoy öz sevimli oğlumu göndәrim, bәlkә ona hörmәt edәrlәr”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But when the farmers saw him, they reasoned among themselves, saying, ‘This is the heir. Come, let's kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.’

block.text: Amma bağbanlar onu gördükdә öz aralarında danışıb dedilәr: “Varis budur. Gәlin onu öldürәk ki, miras bizә qalsın”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They threw him out of the vineyard, and killed him. What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do to them?

block.text: Belәcә onu bağdan kәnara çıxarıb öldürdülәr. Belәliklә, bağ sahibi onlara nә edәcәk?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will come and destroy these farmers, and will give the vineyard to others.”

block.text: Gәlib hәmin bağbanları hәlak edәcәk vә bağı başqalarına verәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they heard it, they said,

block.text: Bunu eşidәnlәrsә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “May it never be!”

block.text: <<Qoy belә olmasın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he looked at them, and said,

block.text: Amma İsa onların gözlәrinin içinә baxıb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then what is this that is written, ‘The stone which the builders rejected, the same was made the chief cornerstone?’

block.text: <<Bәs bu Yazının mәnası nәdir? “Bәnnaların rәdd etdiyi daş Guşәdaşı olub”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who falls on that stone will be broken to pieces, but it will crush whomever it falls on to dust.”

block.text: Bu daşın üstünә yıxılan hәr kәs parçalanacaq, daşsa kimin üzәrinә düşәrsә, onu әzәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on him that very hour, but they feared the people--for they knew he had spoken this parable against them.

block.text: İlahiyyatçılar vә başçı kahinlәr başa düşdülәr ki, İsa bu mәsәli onlar barәdә söylәdi. Ona görә dә hәmin an Onu yaxalamaq üçün yol axtardılar, lakin xalqdan qorxdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They watched him, and sent out spies, who pretended to be righteous, that they might trap him in something he said, so as to deliver him up to the power and authority of the governor.
They asked him,

block.text: İsanı güdürdülәr vә yanına özlәrini dürüst insan kimi göstәrәn bir neçә casus göndәrdilәr. Onu dediyi söz üstә tutub valinin hökm vә sәlahiyyәtinә tәslim etmәk mәqsәdlәri var idi.
Onlar İsadan soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we know that you say and teach what is right, and aren't partial to anyone, but truly teach the way of God.

block.text: <<Müәllim, biz bilirik ki, Sәn düz danışırsan, tәlim öyrәdirsәn vә heç kimә tәrәfkeşlik etmirsәn, ancaq Allahın yolunu hәqiqәtә görә öyrәdirsәn.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Is it lawful for us to pay taxes to Caesar, or not?”

block.text: Bizim üçün qeysәrә vergi vermәyә icazә var ya yox?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he perceived their craftiness, and said to them,

block.text: Amma İsa onların hiylәsini başa düşüb belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you test me?
Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it?”

block.text: <<Mәnә bir dinar göstәrin. Onun üstündәki tәsvir vә yazı kimindir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered,

block.text: Onlar cavab verdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Caesar's.”

block.text: <<Qeysәrin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Then give to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.”

block.text: <<Onda qeysәrin haqqını qeysәrә, Allahın haqqını Allaha verin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They weren't able to trap him in his words before the people. They marveled at his answer, and were silent.

block.text: İsanı xalq qarşısında söz üstә tuta bilmәdilәr vә Onun cavabına heyrәt edib susdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the Sadducees came to him, those who deny that there is a resurrection. They asked him,

block.text: Dirilmәnin olmadığını iddia edәn sadukeylәrdәn bәzisi İsanın yanına gәlib soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, Moses wrote to us that if a man's brother dies having a wife, and he is childless, his brother should take the wife, and raise up children for his brother.

block.text: <<Müәllim, Musa bizim üçün belә yazmışdır: “Әgәr bir adamın evli qardaşı övladsız ölsә, o biri qardaş dul qalmış arvadı alıb ölәn qardaşın nәslini davam etdirsin”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were therefore seven brothers. The first took a wife, and died childless.

block.text: Yeddi qardaş var idi. Birincisi bir arvad aldı vә övladsız öldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The second took her as wife, and he died childless.

block.text: İkincisi dә,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The third took her, and likewise the seven all left no children, and died.

block.text: üçüncüsü dә bu arvadla evlәndi. Belәcә yeddisi dә özündәn sonra övlad qoymadan öldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Afterward the woman also died.

block.text: Hamısından sonra bu qadın da öldü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.”

block.text: Ölülәr dirilәndә bu qadın onlardan hansının arvadı olacaq? Çünki yeddi qardaşın yeddisi dә bu qadını almışdı>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara belә cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The children of this age marry, and are given in marriage.

block.text: <<Bu dövrün insanları evlәnir vә әrә gedir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But those who are considered worthy to attain to that age and the resurrection from the dead, neither marry, nor are given in marriage.

block.text: Amma gәlәcәk dövrә yetişmәyә vә ölülәr arasından dirilmәyә layiq sayılanlar isә nә evlәnәcәk, nә dә әrә gedәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For they can't die any more, for they are like the angels, and are children of God, being children of the resurrection.

block.text: Artıq ölә dә bilmәzlәr, çünki mәlәklәrә bәnzәyirlәr vә dirilmә övladları olduqlarına görә onlar Allahın övladlarıdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But that the dead are raised, even Moses showed at the bush, when he called the Lord ‘The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.’

block.text: Amma ölülәrin dirildiyini Musa da kolla bağlı әhvalatda Rәbbi “İbrahimin Allahı, İshaqın Allahı vә Yaqubun Allahı” adlandıraraq göstәrib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he is not the God of the dead, but of the living, for all are alive to him.”

block.text: Allah ölülәrin deyil, dirilәrin Allahıdır. Çünki Onun yanında hamı diridir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of the scribes answered,

block.text: İlahiyyatçıların bәzisi buna cavab olaraq dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, you speak well.”

block.text: <<Müәllim, Sәn nә gözәl dedin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They didn't dare to ask him any more questions.
He said to them,

block.text: Daha İsadan bir şey soruşmağa cәsarәt etmәdilәr.
Amma İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do they say that the Christ is David's son?

block.text: <<Niyә Mәsih Davudun Oğludur deyirlәr?

ReferenceBlocks.text: David himself says in the book of Psalms, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at my right hand,
until I make your enemies the footstool of your feet.’”

block.text: Axı Davud özü Zәbur kitabında “Rәbb mәnim Ağama dedi: ‹Mәn düşmәnlәrini ayaqlarının altına kәtil kimi salanadәk Sağımda otur›” deyib.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “David therefore calls him Lord, so how is he his son?”

block.text: Demәli, Davud Ona “Ağa” deyә müraciәt edir. O necә Davudun oğlu ola bilәr?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the hearing of all the people, he said to his disciples,

block.text: Bütün xalq bu sözlәri dinlәyәndә İsa Öz şagirdlәrinә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Beware of the scribes, who like to walk in long robes, and love greetings in the marketplaces, the best seats in the synagogues, and the best places at feasts.

block.text: <<İlahiyyatçılardan özünüzü gözlәyin. Onlar uzun paltarlarda gәzmәyi xoşlayar, bazar meydanlarında salam almağı vә sinaqoqlarda baş kürsülәri, ziyafәtlәrdә yuxarı başı tutmağı sevәrlәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They devour widows’ houses, and for a pretense make long prayers: these will receive greater condemnation.”

block.text: Onlar dul qadınların evlәrini yeyib-dağıdar vә özlәrini göstәrmәk üçün uzun-uzadı dua edәrlәr. Bu adamların cәzası daha ağır olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 21
He looked up, and saw the rich people who were putting their gifts into the treasury.

block.text: İsa başını qaldırıb baxdı vә mәbәdin ianә qutusuna ianәlәri atan varlı adamları gördü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He saw a certain poor widow casting in two small brass coins.
He said,

block.text: Bir kasıb dul qadını da gördü. O, ianә qutusuna iki lepton pul atdı.
İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly I tell you, this poor widow put in more than all of them.

block.text: <<Sizә hәqiqәti deyirәm: bu kasıb dul qadın hamıdan çox pul atdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For all these put in gifts for God from their abundance, but she, out of her poverty, put in all that she had to live on.”

block.text: Çünki onların hamısı varlarının artıqlığından ianә verdilәr, bu qadınsa kasıblığına baxmayaraq, dolanmaq üçün әlindә nә varsa, hamısını verdi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some were talking about the temple, saying:

block.text: Bәzi adamlar mәbәdin gözәl daşlar vә Allaha hәsr olunmuş tәqdimlәrlә bәzәndiyini söylәyәrkәn İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Look at the precious stones and offerings to God that adorn the temple!”

block.text: "Bu qiymətli daşlar ve tekliflerden edilib Allaha ki, məbədi bəzəmək baxın!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said:

block.text: İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “As for these things which you see, the days will come, in which there will not be left here one stone on another that will not be thrown down.”

block.text: <<Elә günlәr gәlәcәk ki, burada gördüyünüz şeylәrin daşı daş üstündә qalmayacaq, hamısı yerlә yeksan olacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They asked him,

block.text: Ondan soruşdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are about to happen?”

block.text: <<Müәllim, bәs bu dediklәrin nә vaxt baş verәcәk? Bunlar baş vermәk üzrә olanda hansı әlamәtlәr olacaq?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Watch out that you don't get led astray, for many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am Christ,’ and, ‘The time is at hand.’ Therefore don't follow them.

block.text: <<Ehtiyatlı olun, aldanmayın! Çünki Mәnim adımla çox adam gәlib “mәn Oyam” vә “vaxt yaxınlaşıb” deyәcәk. Onların ardınca getmәyin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, don't be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end won't come immediately.”

block.text: Müharibәlәr vә üsyanlar barәdә eşidәndә tәlaşa düşmәyin. Çünki bunlar әvvәlcәdәn baş vermәlidir, amma hәr şeyin axırı tez gәlmәyәcәk>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to them,

block.text: Sonra onlara belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.

block.text: <<Millәt millәtә, padşahlıq padşahlığa qarşı çıxacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be great earthquakes, famines, and plagues in various places. There will be terrors and great signs from heaven.

block.text: Güclü zәlzәlәlәr, yerbәyer aclıq vә vәba, dәhşәtli hadisәlәr vә göydәn böyük әlamәtlәr olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But before all these things, they will lay their hands on you and will persecute you, delivering you up to synagogues and prisons, bringing you before kings and governors for my name's sake.

block.text: Amma bütün bu hadisәlәrdәn әvvәl Mәnim adıma görә sizi yaxalayacaqlar, tәqib edәcәklәr, sinaqoqlara vә zindanlara tәslim edәcәklәr, padşahların vә valilәrin qarşısına aparacaqlar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This will result in you being witnesses to them.

block.text: Bu işlәr şәhadәt etdiyiniz vaxt olacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Settle it therefore in your hearts not to meditate beforehand how to answer.

block.text: Buna görә dә ürәyinizdә qәrara alın ki, özünüzü necә müdafiә edәcәyiniz barәdә әvvәlcәdәn düşünmәyәsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will give you a mouth and wisdom which all your adversaries will not be able to withstand or to contradict.

block.text: Çünki Mәn sizә elә danışıq qabiliyyәti vә hikmәt verәcәyәm ki, sizә qarşı çıxanların heç biri nә ona etiraz edә bilәcәk, nә dә ona qarşı dura bilәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will be handed over even by parents, brothers, relatives, and friends. They will cause some of you to be put to death.

block.text: Hәtta ata-analarınız, bacı-qardaşlarınız, qohumlarınız vә dostlarınız sizi tәslim edәcәk vә bәzinizi edam etdirәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will be hated by all men for my name's sake.

block.text: Mәnim adıma görә hamı sizә nifrәt edәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And not a hair of your head will perish.”
“By your endurance you will win your lives.”

block.text: Amma başınızdan bir tük belә, әskik olmayacaq.
Dayanıb dözmәklә canlarınızı qurtarın.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But when you see Jerusalem surrounded by armies, then know that its desolation is at hand.

block.text: <<Qoşunların Yerusәlimi mühasirә etdiyini görәndә bilin ki, onun viranә qalacağı vaxt yaxınlaşmışdır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains. Let those who are in the midst of her depart. Let those who are in the country not enter therein.

block.text: O zaman Yәhudeyada olanlar dağlara qaçsın, şәhәrdә olanlar oradan çıxsın vә әtrafda olanlar oraya girmәsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For these are days of vengeance, that all things which are written may be fulfilled.

block.text: Çünki bu günlәr qisas günlәridir ki, bütün yazılanlar yerinә yetsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Woe to those who are pregnant and to those who nurse infants in those days! For there will be great distress in the land, and wrath to this people.

block.text: Hәmin günlәr hamilәlәrin vә körpә әmizdirәnlәrin vay halına! Çünki yer üzünün başına böyük fәlakәt gәlәcәk vә bu xalq qәzәbә uğrayacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will fall by the edge of the sword, and will be led captive into all the nations. Jerusalem will be trampled down by the Gentiles, until the times of the Gentiles are fulfilled.

block.text: Onlar qılıncdan keçirilәcәk vә bütün millәtlәr arasına әsirliyә aparılacaq. Başqa millәtlәrin vaxtı tamam olanadәk Yerusәlim başqa millәtlәrin ayağı altında tapdalanacaq.

ReferenceBlocks.text: There will be signs in the sun, moon, and stars; and on the earth anxiety of nations, in perplexity for the roaring of the sea and the waves.

block.text: Günәşdә, ayda vә ulduzlarda әlamәtlәr görünәcәk. Yer üzündә dәnizin vә dalğaların gurultusundan millәtlәr çaşqınlıq içindә qalıb әzab çәkәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Men will faint for fear, and for expectation of the things which are coming on the world: for the powers of the heavens will be shaken.

block.text: İnsanlar qorxudan vә dünya üzәrinә gәlәn fәlakәtlәri gözlәmәkdәn huşunu itirәcәk, çünki sәma cisimlәri lәrzәyә gәlәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they will see the Son of Man coming in a cloud with power and great glory.

block.text: O zaman onlar Bәşәr Oğlunun bulud içindә qüdrәt vә böyük izzәtlә gәldiyini görәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when these things begin to happen, look up, and lift up your heads, because your redemption is near.”

block.text: Bu hadisәlәr yerinә yetmәyә başladıqda başınızı qaldırın vә yuxarı baxın, çünki satınalınmanız yaxınlaşır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He told them a parable.

block.text: İsa onlara bir mәsәl dә çәkdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “See the fig tree, and all the trees.

block.text: <<Әncir ağacına vә bütün ağaclara baxın:

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they are already budding, you see it and know by your own selves that the summer is already near.

block.text: onların yarpaqlandığını görәndә bilirsiniz ki, yay fәsli artıq yaxındır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so you also, when you see these things happening, know that the Kingdom of God is near.

block.text: Elәcә siz dә bu şeylәrin baş verdiyini görәndә bilin ki, Allahın Padşahlığı yaxınlaşıb.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, this generation will not pass away until all things are accomplished.

block.text: Sizә doğrusunu deyirәm: bu nәsil ömrünü sona çatdırmazdan әvvәl bütün bunlar baş verәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will by no means pass away.”

block.text: Yer vә göy keçib-gedәcәk, amma Mәnim sözlәrim әsla keçib-getmәyәcәk.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: “So be careful, or your hearts will be loaded down with carousing, drunkenness, and cares of this life, and that day will come on you suddenly.

block.text: Özünüzә fikir verin! Qoy ürәklәriniz eyş-işrәt vә sәrxoşluqla, bu hәyatın qayğıları ilә yüklәnmәsin. Qoy qiyamәt günü bir tәlә kimi üzәrinizә qәflәtәn gәlmәsin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it will come like a snare on all those who dwell on the surface of all the earth.

block.text: Çünki o gün yer üzündә yaşayanların hamısının üstünә gәlәcәk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore be watchful all the time, praying that you may be counted worthy to escape all these things that will happen, and to stand before the Son of Man.”

block.text: Ona görә dә baş verәcәk bütün bu fәlakәtlәrdәn qaçıb Bәşәr Oğlunun önündә dura bilmәk üçün hәr an dua edәrәk ayıq olun>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Every day Jesus was teaching in the temple, and every night he would go out and spend the night on the mountain that is called Olivet.

block.text: İsa gündüzlәr mәbәddә tәlim öyrәdirdi, gecәlәri isә oradan çıxaraq Zeytun dağı adlanan dağda keçirirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the people came early in the morning to him in the temple to hear him.

block.text: Sәhәr tezdәn bütün xalq İsanı dinlәmәk üçün Onun yanına, mәbәdә gәlirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 22
Now the feast of unleavened bread, which is called the Passover, drew near.

block.text: Pasxa adlanan Mayasız Çörәk bayramı yaxınlaşırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and the scribes sought how they might put him to death, for they feared the people.

block.text: Başçı kahinlәr vә ilahiyyatçılar İsanı öldürmәk üçün bir yol axtarırdılar, çünki xalqdan qorxurdular.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Satan entered into Judas, who was surnamed Iscariot, who was numbered with the twelve.

block.text: O zaman Şeytan On İki şagirddәn biri olan İskaryot adlanan Yәhudanın ürәyinә girdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went to talk with the chief priests and captains, saying:

block.text: O, baş kahinlər və kapitanları ilə danışmaq üçün belə etmişdir:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will deliver him to you.”

block.text: "Mən sizə onu verəcəkdir."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were glad, and said:

block.text: Onlar şad idi və dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We will pay you for this.”

block.text: "Biz bu üçün verəcəkdir."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He consented, and sought an opportunity to deliver him to them in the absence of the multitude.

block.text: Buna söz verәn Yәhuda İsanı xalqdan gizlin onlara tәslim etmәk üçün fürsәt axtarmağa başladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The day of unleavened bread came, on which the Passover must be sacrificed.

block.text: Pasxa quzusunun qurban kәsilmәli olduğu Mayasız Çörәk bayramı günü gәldi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent Peter and John, saying,

block.text: İsa Peter vә Yәhyanı qabaqca göndәrib dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat.”

block.text: <<Gedin, Pasxa yemәyimiz üçün bizә hazırlıq görün>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Onlarsa İsadan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where do you want us to prepare?”

block.text: <<Harada hazırlıq görmәyimizi istәyirsәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, when you have entered into the city, a man carrying a pitcher of water will meet you. Follow him into the house which he enters.

block.text: <<Bax siz şәhәrә girәndә qarşınıza sәhәnglә su daşıyan bir nәfәr çıxacaq. Onun ardınca gedin vә onun girәcәyi evә girin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Tell the master of the house, ‘The Teacher says to you, “Where is the guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?”’

block.text: Oranın sahibinә deyin: “Müәllim sәnә deyir: ‹Şagirdlәrimlә birgә Pasxa yemәyini yeyәcәyim qonaq otağı haradadır?›”

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will show you a large, furnished upper room. Make preparations there.”

block.text: Ev sahibi sizә yuxarı mәrtәbәdә hәr şeyi hazırlanmış böyük bir otaq göstәrәcәk. Orada hazırlıq işlәri görün>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They went, found things as he had told them, and they prepared the Passover.

block.text: Onlar gedib hәr şeyin Onun dediyi kimi olduğunu gördülәr vә Pasxa yemәyi üçün hazırlıq etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the hour had come, he sat down with the twelve apostles.
He said to them,

block.text: Yemәk vaxtı çatanda İsa hәvarilәrlә süfrәyә oturdu.
İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I have earnestly desired to eat this Passover with you before I suffer.

block.text: <<Mәn әzab çәkmәzdәn әvvәl bu Pasxa yemәyini sizinlә birgә yemәyi çox arzulayırdım.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, I will no longer by any means eat of it until it is fulfilled in the Kingdom of God.”

block.text: Sizә bunu deyirәm: Pasxa Allahın Padşahlığında yerinә yetәnәdәk Mәn bir daha onu yemәyәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He received a cup, and when he had given thanks, he said,

block.text: Sonra İsa bir kasa götürüb şükür etdi vә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Take this, and share it among yourselves.

block.text: <<Bunu götürün vә aranızda bölüşdürün.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you, I will not drink at all again from the fruit of the vine, until the Kingdom of God comes.”

block.text: Mәn sizә deyirәm: Allahın Padşahlığı gәlәnәdәk üzüm ağacının mәhsulundan әsla içmәyәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it, and gave to them, saying,

block.text: Sonra İsa çörәk götürdü, şükür edib onu böldü vә şagirdlәrә verәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my body which is given for you. Do this in memory of me.”

block.text: <<Bu Mәnim sizin üçün verilәn bәdәnimdir. Bunu Mәni xatırlamaq üçün edin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Likewise, he took the cup after supper, saying,

block.text: Elәcә dә axşam yemәyindәn sonra kasanı götürüb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This cup is the new covenant in my blood, which is poured out for you.

block.text: <<Sizin üçün axıdılan bu kasa Mәnim qanımla bağladığım Yeni Әhddir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But behold, the hand of him who betrays me is with me on the table.

block.text: Amma budur, Mәnә xәyanәt edәn Mәnimlә birlikdә әlini bu süfrәyә uzadır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man indeed goes, as it has been determined, but woe to that man through whom he is betrayed!”

block.text: Bәşәr Oğlu tәyin edilmiş yolla gedir. Amma vay o adamın halına ki, Ona xәyanәt edir!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They began to question among themselves, saying:

block.text: Onlar öz aralarında suala belə başladı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who among us would do such a terrible thing?”

block.text: "Kim arasında bizə belə bir dəhşətli şey istəyirsiniz?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: There also arose a contention among them. They argued, saying:

block.text: Həmçinin onların arasında mübahisə yaranmışdı. Onlar belə iddia:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Which one of us is the greatest?”

block.text: "Bu bizə bir daha böyükdür?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Amma İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The kings of the nations lord it over them, and those who have authority over them are called ‘benefactors.’

block.text: <<Millәtlәrin padşahları onların üzәrindә hökm edir vә bu hakimiyyәtdә olanlar himayәdar adlanır.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But not so with you. But one who is the greater among you, let him become as the younger, and one who is governing, as one who serves.

block.text: Amma siz belә olmayın. Aranızda әn böyük olan әn kiçik kimi olsun vә rәhbәrlik edәn xidmәtçi kimi olsun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For who is greater, one who sits at the table, or one who serves? Isn't it he who sits at the table? But I am in the midst of you as one who serves.

block.text: Axı kim daha böyükdür, süfrәdә oturan, yoxsa xidmәt edәn? Süfrәdә oturan deyilmi? Mәnsә sizin aranızda xidmәtçi kimiyәm.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you are those who have continued with me in my trials.

block.text: Keçirdiyim sınaqlarda Mәnimlә qalanlar sizsiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I confer on you a kingdom, even as my Father conferred on me.

block.text: Atam Mәnә bir padşahlıq tapşırdığı kimi Mәn dә sizә bir padşahlıq tapşırıram;

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then you may eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom. You will sit on thrones, judging the twelve tribes of Israel.”

block.text: belә ki Mәnim Padşahlığımda süfrәmdә yeyib-içәsiniz vә İsrailin on iki qәbilәsinә hökm etmәk üçün taxtlarda oturasınız.>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord said,

block.text: İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Simon, Simon, behold, Satan asked to have you, that he might sift you as wheat,

block.text: <<Şimon, Şimon! Şeytan sizi buğda kimi xәlbirdәn keçirmәyә icazә istәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but I prayed for you, that your faith wouldn't fail. You, when once you have turned again, must help to strengthen your brothers.”

block.text: Amma Mәn imanın itmәsin deyә sәnin üçün dua etdim. Sәn dә bir zaman geri dönüb öz qardaşlarını qüvvәtlәndir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to him,

block.text: O, İsaya cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, I am ready to go with you both to prison and to death!”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, mәn Sәninlә zindana da, ölümә dә getmәyә hazıram>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Amma İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I tell you, Peter, the rooster will by no means crow today until you deny that you know me three times.”

block.text: <<Peter, sәnә bunu deyirәm: bu gün xoruz banlamazdan әvvәl sәn Mәni tanıdığını üç dәfә inkar edәcәksәn>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Sonra şagirdlәrә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “When I sent you out without purse, and wallet, and shoes, did you lack anything?”

block.text: <<Mәn sizi kisәsiz, torbasız vә çarıqsız göndәrәndә bir şeydә korluq çәkmisinizmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Onlar cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Nothing.”

block.text: <<Heç bir şeydә>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to them,

block.text: Onda İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But now, whoever has a purse, let him take it, and likewise a wallet. Whoever has none, let him sell his cloak, and buy a sword.

block.text: <<İndi isә kisәsi vә torbası olan bunları götürsün. Qılıncı olmayan da öz paltarını satıb qılınc alsın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I tell you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in me: ‘He was counted with transgressors.’ For that which concerns me has an end.”

block.text: Çünki sizә deyirәm: bu yazılmış olan “Üsyankarlara tay tutuldu” sözü Mәndә tam yerinә yetmәlidir. Çünki Mәnim barәmdә yazılanlar tamam olur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Onlar dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, behold, here are two swords.”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, budur, burada iki qılınc var>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: O isә onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “That is enough.”

block.text: <<Bu kifayәtdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came out, and went, as his custom was, to the Mount of Olives. His disciples also followed him.

block.text: İsa çıxıb adәtinә görә Zeytun dağına getdi. Şagirdlәr dә Onun ardınca getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he was at the place, he said to them,

block.text: Oraya çatanda İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Pray that you don't enter into temptation.”

block.text: <<Dua edin ki, sınağa düşmәyәsiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He was withdrawn from them about a stone's throw, and he knelt down and prayed,
saying,

block.text: İsa Özü isә onlardan bir daş atımı qәdәr uzaqlaşdı vә diz çöküb dua etdi.
O belә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Father, if you are willing, remove this cup from me. Nevertheless, not my will, but yours, be done.”

block.text: <<Ey Ata, әgәr Sәnin iradәnә mәqbuldursa, bu kasanı Mәndәn uzaqlaşdır. Amma Mәnim yox, Sәnin iradәn olsun>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: An angel from heaven appeared to him, strengthening him.

block.text: Göydәn bir mәlәk İsaya göründü vә Onu qüvvәtlәndirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being in agony he prayed more earnestly. His sweat became like great drops of blood falling down on the ground.

block.text: İsa dәhşәtli iztirab içindә daha sәylә dua edirdi. Onun tәri yerә düşәn qan damlalarına bәnzәyirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he rose up from his prayer, he came to the disciples, and found them sleeping because of grief,
and said to them,

block.text: İsa duadan qalxıb şagirdlәrin yanına gәldi, onları kәdәrdәn üzülmüş vә yatmış tapdı.
O, şagirdlәrә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you sleep? Rise and pray that you may not enter into temptation.”

block.text: <<Nә üçün yatırsınız? Qalxın, dua edin ki, sınağa düşmәyәsiniz>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was still speaking, behold, a multitude, and he who was called Judas, one of the twelve, was leading them. He came near to Jesus to kiss him.
But Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa hәlә danışarkәn bir izdiham göründü. On İki şagirddәn biri, Yәhuda adlı bir nәfәr onlardan qabaqda gedirdi. O, İsanı öpmәk üçün yaxınlaşdı.
Amma İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Judas, do you betray the Son of Man with a kiss?”

block.text: <<Yәhuda, sәn Bәşәr Oğlunu bir öpüşlәmi satırsan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When those who were around him saw what was about to happen, they said to him,

block.text: İsanın әtrafında olanlar nә baş verәcәyini görәndә Ona dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”

block.text: <<Ya Rәbb, bәlkә qılıncla vuraq?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain one of them struck the servant of the high priest, and
cut off his right ear.
But Jesus answered,

block.text: Onlardan biri baş kahinin qulunu vurub
sağ qulağını qopartdı.
Lakin İsa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Permit them to seize me.”

block.text: <<Bәsdir, elәmәyin>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and he touched his ear, and healed him.

block.text: Sonra qulun qulağına toxunaraq onu sağaltdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to the chief priests, captains of the temple, and elders, who had come against him,

block.text: İsa üstünә gәlәn başçı kahinlәrә, mәbәd mühafizәçilәrinin başçılarına vә ağsaqqallara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have you come out as against a robber, with swords and clubs?

block.text: <<Nә üçün quldur üstünә gәlәn kimi qılınc vә dәyәnәklәrlә gәlmisiniz?

ReferenceBlocks.text: When I was with you in the temple daily, you didn't stretch out your hands against me. But this is your hour, and the power of darkness.”

block.text: Mәn hәr gün mәbәddә sizinlә birlikdә olanda siz Mәnә әl qaldırmadınız. Amma indi sizin vaxtınızdır, zülmәt hökmranlığıdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They seized him, and led him away, and brought him into the high priest's house. But Peter followed from a distance.

block.text: İsanı tutub apardılar vә baş kahinin evinә gәtirdilәr. Peter isә uzaqdan Onun ardınca gedirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard, and had sat down together, Peter sat among them.

block.text: Hәyәtin ortasında tonqal qalanmışdı. Peter gәlib onun әtrafında oturanların arasında oturdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A certain servant girl saw him as he sat in the light, and looking intently at him, said,

block.text: Qarabaşlardan biri tonqalın işığında oturan Peteri gördü. Ona diqqәtlә baxıb dedi:

block.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: servant girl at high priest's courtyard
ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man also was with him.”

block.text: <<Bu adam da İsa ilә birlikdә idi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He denied Jesus, saying,

block.text: Amma Peter deyәrәk Onu inkar etdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woman, I don't know him.”

block.text: <<Ay arvad, mәn Onu tanımıram!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After a little while someone else saw him, and said,

block.text: Bir az sonra başqa bir adam onu görüb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You also are one of them!”

block.text: <<Sәn dә onlardansan>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter answered,

block.text: Amma Peter dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Man, I am not!”

block.text: <<Ay kişi, mәn deyilәm!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: After about one hour passed, another confidently affirmed, saying,

block.text: Bir saata yaxın vaxt keçdi vә digәr bir adam tәkidlә dedi:

block.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)/those standing near

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: high priest's servant (relative of the man whose ear Peter cut off)/those standing near
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Truly this man also was with him, for he is a Galilean!”

block.text: <<Doğrudan da, bu adam da Onunla birlikdә idi, çünki Qalileyalıdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter said,

block.text: Amma Peter dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Man, I don't know what you are talking about!”

block.text: <<Ay kişi, dediyini başa düşmürәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.

block.text: Elә o danışdığı an xoruz banladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Lord turned, and looked at Peter. Then Peter remembered the Lord's word, how he said to him,

block.text: Onda Rәbb dönüb Peterә baxdı. Peter Rәbbin dediyi sözü yadına saldı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Before the rooster crows you will deny me three times.”

block.text: <<bu gün xoruz banlamazdan әvvәl sәn Mәni üç dәfә inkar edәcәksәn>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went out, and wept bitterly.

block.text: Ona görә oradan çıxıb hönkür-hönkür ağladı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men who held Jesus mocked him and beat him.

block.text: İsanı tutub saxlayan adamlar Onu әlә sala-sala döyürdü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having blindfolded him, they struck him on the face and asked him,

block.text: Onun gözlәrini bağlayıb Ondan soruşurdular:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Prophesy! Who is the one who struck you?”

block.text: <<Peyğәmbәrlik elә görәk, Sәni vuran kimdir?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They spoke many other things against him, insulting him.

block.text: Ona başqa sözlәr deyib çoxlu böhtan atırdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As soon as it was day, the assembly of the elders of the people was gathered together, both chief priests and scribes, and they led him away into their council, saying,

block.text: Sәhәr açıldıqda xalqın ağsaqqalları, başçı kahinlәr vә ilahiyyatçılar yığıldı vә İsanı öz Ali Şuralarına gәtirdilәr. Onlar dedilәr:

block.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law
ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you are the Christ, tell us.”

block.text: <<Bizә de, Mәsih Sәnsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I tell you, you won't believe,
and if I ask, you will in no way answer me or let me go.

block.text: <<Әgәr sizә desәm, inanmazsınız.
Әgәr sizdәn soruşsam, Mәnә cavab vermәyәcәksiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From now on, the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of the power of God.”

block.text: Bundan sonra isә Bәşәr Oğlu qüdrәtli Allahın sağında oturacaq>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all said,

block.text: Onların hamısı dedi:

block.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you then the Son of God?”

block.text: <<Demәli, Sәn Allahın Oğlusan?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You say it, because I am.”

block.text: <<Sizin dediyiniz kimi O Mәnәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said,

block.text: Onda onlar dedilәr:

block.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do we need any more witness? For we ourselves have heard from his own mouth!”

block.text: <<Artıq şәhadәtә nә ehtiyacımız var? Axı biz özümüz Onun ağzından eşitdik>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 23
The whole company of them rose up and brought him before Pilate.

block.text: Ali Şura üzvlәrinin hamısı ayağa durub İsanı Pilatın yanına apardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They began to accuse him, saying,

block.text: Onu ittiham etmәyә başlayaraq dedilәr:

block.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: council of elders/chief priests/teachers of religious law
ReferenceBlocks.text: “We found this man perverting the nation, forbidding paying taxes to Caesar, and saying that he himself is Christ, a king.”

block.text: <<Biz gördük ki, bu adam millәtimizi yoldan çıxarır. Qeysәrә vergi vermәyә mane olur vә Özünü Mәsih, Padşah adlandırır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate asked him,

block.text: Pilat Ondan deyә soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the King of the Jews?”

block.text: <<Yәhudilәrin Padşahı Sәnsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered him,

block.text: İsa cavabında ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes… It is as you say.”

block.text: <<Sәnin dediyin kimidir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate said to the chief priests and the multitudes,

block.text: Pilat başçı kahinlәrә vә xalqa dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I find no basis for a charge against this man.”

block.text: <<Mәn bu Adamda heç bir tәqsir görmürәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they insisted, saying,

block.text: Amma onlar tәkid edәrәk deyirdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He stirs up the people, teaching throughout all Judea, beginning from Galilee even to this place.”

block.text: <<Bu Adam Qalileyadan tutmuş bu yerә qәdәr bütün Yәhudeyada tәlim öyrәdәrәk xalqı tәşvişә salır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Pilate heard Galilee mentioned, he asked:

block.text: Pilat Qalileya barәdә eşidәrәk soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is this man a Galilean?”

block.text: <<Mәgәr bu Adam Qalileyalıdır?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he found out that he was in Herod's jurisdiction, he sent him to Herod, who was also in Jerusalem during those days.

block.text: İsanın Hirodun idarә etdiyi vilayәtdәn olduğunu bildikdә Onu Hirodun yanına göndәrdi. Çünki o günlәr Hirod da Yerusәlimdә idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Herod saw Jesus, he was exceedingly glad, for he had wanted to see him for a long time, because he had heard many things about him. He hoped to see some miracle done by him.

block.text: Hirod İsanı gördükdә çox sevindi. Onun haqqında eşitdiyi şeylәrә görә Onu çoxdan görmәk istәyirdi. Ondan bir әlamәt görmәyi umurdu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He questioned him with many words, but he gave no answers.

block.text: Hirod Ona çox suallar verdi, amma İsa ona heç bir cavab vermәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and the scribes stood, vehemently accusing him.

block.text: Başçı kahinlәr vә ilahiyyatçılar durub Onu şiddәtlә ittiham edirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod with his soldiers humiliated him and mocked him. Dressing him in luxurious clothing, they sent him back to Pilate.

block.text: Hirod öz әsgәrlәri ilә Onu tәhqir edib әlә saldı. Onun әyninә bir gözәl paltar geyindirib Pilatın yanına qaytardı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod and Pilate became friends with each other that very day, for before that they were enemies with each other.

block.text: Әvvәllәr düşmәn olan Pilatla Hirod o gün bir-biri ilә dostlaşdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pilate called together the chief priests and the rulers and the people,
and said to them,

block.text: O zaman Pilat başçı kahinlәri, rәhbәrlәri vә xalqı toplayıb
onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You brought this man to me as one that perverts the people, and see, I have examined him before you, and found no basis for a charge against this man concerning those things of which you accuse him.

block.text: <<Siz bu Adamı mәnim yanıma buna görә gәtirdiniz ki, O, xalqı yoldan çıxarır. Budur, mәn sizin qarşınızda mәsәlәni araşdırıb bu Adamı sizin irәli sürdüyünüz ittihamların heç birindә tәqsirkar görmәdim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither has Herod, for I sent you to him, and see, nothing worthy of death has been done by him.

block.text: Hirod da bir şey tapmadı. Çünki bu Adamı bizә geri göndәrdi. Budur, O, ölüm cәzasına layiq heç bir şey etmәyib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I will therefore chastise him and release him.”

block.text: Buna görә dә mәn Onu cәzalandırıb azad edәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now he had to release one prisoner to them at the feast.
But they all cried out together, saying,

block.text: Hәr Pasxa bayramında Pilat xalqın xahişi ilә bir mәhbusu azad edәrdi.
Amma bütün xalq birlikdә çığırırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Away with this man! Release Barabbas to us!”

block.text: <<Bu Adam öldürülsün! Bizә Barabbanı azad et!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: one who was thrown into prison for a certain revolt in the city, and for murder.

block.text: Barabba şәhәrdә üsyan qaldırmaq vә adam öldürmәk üstündә zindana atılmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Pilate spoke to them again, saying:

block.text: Sonra Pilat onlara daha belə dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why not release Jesus?”

block.text: "Nə İsa azad etmir?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: but they shouted, saying,

block.text: Amma onlar deyә bağırırdı:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Crucify him! Crucify him!”

block.text: <<Onu çarmıxa çәk, çarmıxa çәk!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them the third time,

block.text: Pilat üçüncü dәfә onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why? What evil has this man done? I have found no capital crime in him. I will therefore chastise him and release him.”

block.text: <<Axı O nә pislik edib? Mәn Onda ölüm cәzasına layiq heç bir tәqsir görmәdim. Buna görә dә Onu cәzalandırıb azad edәcәyәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they shouted all the more, saying:

block.text: Lakin onlar belə bütün daha səslədilər:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Crucify him! Crucify him!”

block.text: "Onu çarmıxa çəkdirəcəyəm! Onu çarmıxa çəkdirəcəyəm!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Their voices and the voices of the chief priests prevailed.
Pilate said:

block.text: Onların sәsi hamıdan bәrk gәlirdi.
Pilat dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will do what you ask.”

block.text: "Mən nə istəmirəm olacaq."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He released Barrabus, the prisoner they asked for. He had been thrown into prison for insurrection and murder. Then Pilate gave Jesus to them, saying:

block.text: Üsyan qaldırıb adam öldürdüyünә görә zindana atılmış adamı onların tәlәbinә görә azad etdi. Sonra Pilate onlara belə İsa verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do what you want with him.”

block.text: "Nə onunla istəyirsiniz."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they led him away, they grabbed one Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, and laid on him the cross, to carry it after Jesus.

block.text: Әsgәrlәr İsanı apararkәn kәnd yerindәn gәlәn Şimon adlı Kirenalı bir nәfәri yaxaladılar. Çarmıxı onun boynuna yüklәyib İsanın ardınca daşımağa mәcbur etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A great multitude of the people followed him, including women who also mourned and lamented him.
But Jesus, turning to them, said,

block.text: İsanın ardınca böyük bir izdiham vә Onun üçün ağlayıb nalә çәkәn qadınlar gedirdi.
İsa onlara tәrәf dönüb dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Daughters of Jerusalem, don't weep for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.

block.text: <<Ey Yerusәlim qızları, Mәnim üçün ağlamayın. Özünüz vә övladlarınız üçün ağlayın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For behold, the days are coming in which they will say, ‘Blessed are the barren, the wombs that never bore, and the breasts that never nursed.’

block.text: Çünki elә günlәr gәlir ki “Nә bәxtiyardır sonsuz, doğmamış bәtnlәr vә әmizdirmәmiş döşlәri olan qadınlar!” deyәcәklәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then they will begin to tell the mountains, ‘Fall on us!’ and tell the hills, ‘Cover us.’

block.text: “O zaman dağlara ‹Üstümüzә yıxılın!›, tәpәlәrә ‹Bizi örtün!› demәyә başlayacaqlar”.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if they do these things when the tree is green, what will happen when it is dry?”

block.text: Çünki yaşıl ağacın başına bunları gәtirirlәrsә, bәs qurumuş ağaca nә olacaq?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: There were also others, two criminals, led with him to be put to death.

block.text: İsa ilә birlikdә iki cinayәtkar da edama aparıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they came to the place that is called The Skull, they crucified him there with the criminals, one on the right and the other on the left.
Jesus said,

block.text: Kәllә adlanan yerә gәlәndә orada Onu vә cinayәtkarları – birini sağında, birini dә solunda çarmıxa çәkdilәr.
Amma İsa deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Father, forgive them, for they don't know what they are doing.”

block.text: <<Ata! Onları bağışla, çünki nә etdiklәrini bilmirlәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Dividing his garments among them, they cast lots.

block.text: Püşk ataraq paltarlarını aralarında bölüşdürdülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The people stood watching. The rulers with them also scoffed at him, saying,

block.text: Camaat durub tamaşa edirdi. Onlarla birlikdә rәhbәrlәr dә İsaya istehza edib deyirdilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He saved others. Let him save himself, if this is the Christ of God, his chosen one!”

block.text: <<Başqalarını xilas edirdi. Әgәr O, Allahın seçdiyi Mәsihdirsә, qoy Özünü dә xilas etsin!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: The soldiers also mocked him, coming to him and offering him vinegar,
and saying,

block.text: Әsgәrlәr dә yaxınlaşıb Onu әlә saldı. Ona şәrab sirkәsi tәqdim edib
belә dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you are the King of the Jews, save yourself!”

block.text: <<Әgәr Sәn Yәhudilәrin Padşahısansa, Özünü xilas et!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: An inscription was also written over him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: “THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

block.text: Onun üzәrindә <<Yәhudilәrin Padşahı budur>> yazısı yazılmışdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: One of the criminals who was hanged insulted him, saying,

block.text: Çarmıxa asılmış cinayәtkarlardan biri Ona böhtan ataraq deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you are the Christ, save yourself and us!”

block.text: <<Mәgәr Sәn Mәsih deyilsәn? Özünü dә, bizi dә xilas et!>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the other answered, and rebuking him said,

block.text: O biri cinayәtkarsa ona qadağan edәrәk deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don't you even fear God, seeing you are under the same condemnation?

block.text: <<Sәn heç Allahdan qorxmursan? Sәn özün dә eyni cәzaya mәhkum olmusan!

ReferenceBlocks.text: And we indeed justly, for we receive the due reward for our deeds, but this man has done nothing wrong.”

block.text: Biz әdalәtlә mәhkum olunmuşuq, çünki әmәllәrimizә layiq olan әvәzi alırıq. Bu Adamsa heç bir haqsızlıq etmәmişdi>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to Jesus,

block.text: Sonra İsaya dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, remember me when you come into your Kingdom.”

block.text: <<Ay İsa, Öz Padşahlığına gәlәndә mәni xatırla!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: İsa ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Assuredly I tell you, today you will be with me in Paradise.”

block.text: <<Sәnә doğrusunu deyirәm: bu gün sәn Mәnimlә birlikdә cәnnәtdә olacaqsan>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was now about the sixth hour, and darkness came over the whole land until the ninth hour.

block.text: Gündüz altıncı saat idi. Doqquzuncu saata qәdәr bütün yer üzünә qaranlıq çökdü,

ReferenceBlocks.text: The sun was darkened, and the veil of the temple was torn in two.

block.text: günәş işığını saçmırdı. Mәbәdin pәrdәsi ortadan parçalandı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, crying with a loud voice, said,

block.text: İsa uca sәslә nida edәrәk dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Father, into your hands I commit my spirit!”

block.text: <<Ey Ata! Ruhumu Sәnin әlinә verirәm>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having said this, he breathed his last.

block.text: İsa bunu deyib axır nәfәsini verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the centurion saw what was done, he glorified God, saying,

block.text: Bunları görәn yüzbaşı deyәrәk Allahı izzәtlәndirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Certainly this was a righteous man.”

block.text: <<doğrudan da, bu Adam saleh idi>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the multitudes that came together to see this, when they saw the things that were done, returned home beating their breasts.

block.text: Bunlara tamaşa etmәk üçün yığılan bütün camaat baş verәn hadisәni gördükdә sinәsinә döyә-döyә geri döndü.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All his acquaintances, and the women who followed with him from Galilee, stood at a distance, watching these things.

block.text: İsanı tanıyan adamların hamısı vә Onun ardınca Qalileyadan gәlmiş qadınlar uzaqda durub olub-keçәnlәrә baxırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, there was a man named Joseph, who was a member of the council, a good and righteous man.

block.text: Ali Şuranın üzvü olan Yusif adlı xeyirxah vә saleh bir kişi var idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: (He had not consented to their counsel and deed). He was from Arimathaea, a city of the Jews, and he was also waiting for the Kingdom of God:

block.text: O, Ali Şuranın qәrarı vә әmәli ilә razı olmamışdı. Bu adam Yәhudeyanın Arimateya şәhәrindәn idi vә o da Allahın Padşahlığını gözlәyirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This man went to Pilate, and asked for Jesus’ body.

block.text: O, Pilatın yanına gedib İsanın cәsәdini istәdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took it down, and wrapped it in a linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb that was cut in stone, where no one had ever been laid.

block.text: Cәsәdi çarmıxdan endirib kәfәnә bükdü vә qayada qazılmış, hәlә indiyәdәk heç kimin dәfn edilmәdiyi bir qәbirә qoydu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was the day of the Preparation, and the Sabbath was drawing near.

block.text: O gün Hazırlıq günü idi vә Şәnbә günü yaxınlaşırdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The women, who had come with him out of Galilee, followed after, and saw the tomb, and how his body was laid.

block.text: İsa ilә Qalileyadan gәlmiş qadınlar da Yusifin ardınca gedib qәbiri vә Onun cәsәdinin necә qoyulduğunu gördülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They returned, and prepared spices and ointments. On the Sabbath they rested according to the commandment.

block.text: Onlar evlәrinә qayıdıb әtirli maddәlәr vә qiymәtli yağlar hazırladılar. Şәnbә günü Allahın әmri ilә istirahәt etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: LUKE CHP 24
But on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they and some others came to the tomb, bringing the spices which they had prepared.

block.text: Hәftәnin ilk günü sәhәr çox erkәn qadınlar hazırladıqları әtirlәri götürüb qәbirin yanına gәldilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They found the stone rolled away from the tomb.

block.text: Qәbirin qapısındakı daşı yuvarlanmış gördülәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They entered in, and didn't find the Lord Jesus’ body.

block.text: Amma içәri girib Rәbb İsanın cәsәdini tapmadılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were greatly perplexed about this and said:

block.text: Onlar çox bu barədə çaşqın idi və dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is his body?”

block.text: "Harada onun orqanıdır?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Suddenly, two men stood by them in dazzling clothing.
Becoming terrified, they bowed their faces down to the earth. They said to them,

block.text: Birdən iki kişilər onların qamaşdırıcı geyim də təşkil etmişdir.
Qadınlar tәlaş içindә üzüstә yerә sәrildi. Kişilәr soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you seek the living among the dead?

block.text: <<Nә üçün siz Dirini ölülәr arasında axtarırsınız?

ReferenceBlocks.text: He isn't here, but is risen. Remember what he told you when he was still in Galilee:

block.text: O burada yoxdur, O dirilmişdir! Hәlә Qalileyada olarkәn Onun sizә dediklәrini yadınıza salın.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said that the Son of Man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again?”

block.text: Demişdi ki, “Bәşәr Oğlu günahkar insanlara tәslim olmalı, çarmıxa çәkilmәli vә üçüncü gün dirilmәlidir”>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After hearing these words, the women said to each other:

block.text: Bu sözlər eşitmə sonra, qadınlar bir-birinə dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you remember what he said?”

block.text: "Sizə nə demişdi edirsiniz?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They returned from the tomb and told all these things to the eleven, and to all the rest.

block.text: Qәbirdәn qayıdan qadınlar bütün bunları On Bir şagirdә vә başqa adamların hamısına xәbәr verdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now they were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, and Mary the mother of James. The other women with them told these things to the apostles.

block.text: Hәvarilәrә bu xәbәri çatdıranlar Mәcdәlli Mәryәm, Yoxanna, Yaqubun anası Mәryәm vә onlarla birgә olan digәr qadınlar idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: These words seemed to them to be nonsense, and they didn't believe them.

block.text: Amma bu sözlәr hәvarilәrә mәnasız göründü vә qadınlara inanmadılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Peter got up and ran to the tomb. Stooping and looking in, he saw the strips of linen lying by themselves, and he departed to his home, wondering what had happened.

block.text: Peter isә qalxıb qәbirә tәrәf qaçdı. O әyilib yalnız kәtan bezlәri gördü vә bu hadisәyә heyrәt edәrәk öz evinә qayıtdı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, two of them were going that very day to a village named Emmaus, which was sixty stadia from Jerusalem.

block.text: Elә o gün onlardan ikisi Yerusәlimdәn altmış stadi uzaqlığında yerlәşәn Xamma adlı kәndә gedirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They talked with each other about all of these things which had happened.

block.text: Onlar olub-keçәn bütün bu hadisәlәr barәdә öz aralarında söhbәt edirdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, while they talked and questioned together, that Jesus himself came near, and went with them.

block.text: Onlar söhbәt edәrәk öz aralarında müzakirә edәrkәn İsa Özü yaxınlaşıb onlarla birlikdә yol getdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But their eyes were kept from recognizing him.
He said to them,

block.text: Amma onların gözlәri bağlanmışdı, buna görә dә Onu tanımadılar.
İsa onlardan soruşdu:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What are you talking about as you walk?”

block.text: <<Siz yol gedә-gedә öz aranızda nә barәdә danışırsınız?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were very sad.
One of them, named Cleopas, answered him,

block.text: Onlar çox kədərli idi.
Onlardan Kleopa adlı bir nәfәr İsaya cavab verdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the only stranger in Jerusalem who doesn't know the things which have happened there in these days?”

block.text: <<Yerusәlimdә qalıb vә bu günlәrdә orada baş vermiş hadisәlәrdәn xәbәri olmayan bircә sәnsәnmi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What things?”

block.text: <<Hansı hadisәlәrdәn?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Onlar da Ona dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The things concerning Jesus, the Nazarene, who was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people;

block.text: <<Nazaretli İsa barәsindәki hadisәlәrdәn. O, Allahın vә bütün xalqın önündә әmәldә vә sözdә qüdrәtli bir peyğәmbәr idi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and they crucified him.

block.text: Bizim başçı kahin vә rәhbәrlәrimiz Onu ölümә mәhkum etmәk üçün tәslim edib çarmıxa çәkdirdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But we were hoping that it was he who would redeem Israel. Yes, and besides all this, it is now the third day since these things happened.

block.text: Biz dә ümid edirdik ki, bu, İsrailin gәlәcәk Satınalanıdır. Bundan әlavә, bu hadisәlәr artıq üç gündür ki, baş verib.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Also, certain women of our company amazed us, having arrived early at the tomb.

block.text: Üstәlik bizim qadınlardan bәzisi dә bizi mat qoydular: onlar sәhәr erkәn qәbir üstünә gedib

ReferenceBlocks.text: And when they didn't find his body, they came saying that they had also seen a vision of angels, who said that he was alive.

block.text: Onun cәsәdini orada tapa bilmәyiblәr vә gәlib dedilәr ki, görüntüdә Onun diri olduğunu bәyan edәn mәlәklәri görüblәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Some of us went to the tomb, and found it just like the women had said, but they didn't see him.”

block.text: Bizimlә olan bәzilәri qәbirә gedib oranı qadınların dediyi kimi olduğunu müәyyәn etdilәr, amma Onu görmәdilәr>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Onda İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Foolish men, and slow of heart to believe in all that the prophets have spoken!

block.text: <<Ey ağılsızlar vә peyğәmbәrlәrin xәbәr verdiklәrinә inanmaq üçün ürәyindә lәngiyәnlәr!

ReferenceBlocks.text: Didn't the Christ have to suffer these things and to enter into his glory?”

block.text: Mәsih bu әzabları çәkib Öz izzәtinә qovuşmalı deyildimi?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: Beginning from Moses and from all the prophets, he explained to them in all the Scriptures the things concerning himself.

block.text: Sonra Musa ilә bütün Peyğәmbәrlәrdәn başlayaraq Müqәddәs Yazıların hamısında Özü haqqında olanları onlara izah etdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They drew near to the village, where they were going, and he acted like he would go further.
They urged him, saying,

block.text: Onlar getdiklәri kәndә yaxınlaşdılar. İsa Özünü yoluna davam etmәk istәyәn kimi apardı.
Amma onlar İsadan tәkidlә xahiş edib dedilәr:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stay with us, for it is almost evening, and the day is almost over.”

block.text: <<Bizimlә qal, çünki axşam düşür vә gün batmaq üzrәdir>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He went in to stay with them.

block.text: O da onlarla qalmaq üçün içәri girdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, that when he had sat down at the table with them, he took the bread and gave thanks. Breaking it, he gave to them.

block.text: İsa onlarla süfrәyә oturanda çörәk götürüb şükür duası etdi, böldü vә onlara verdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then, their eyes were opened and they recognized him, and he vanished out of their sight.

block.text: Bu anda onların gözlәri açıldı vә onlar İsanı tanıdı. Amma İsa onlar üçün görünmәz oldu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said one to another,

block.text: Onlar bir-birlәrinә dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Weren't our hearts burning within us, while he spoke to us along the way, and while he opened the Scriptures to us?”

block.text: <<O, yolda bizimlә danışıb vә Müqәddәs Yazıları bizә izah edәndә bizim ürәklәrimiz alışıb-yanmırdımı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They rose up that very hour, returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and those who were with them,
saying,

block.text: Onlar elә o saat qalxıb Yerusәlimә qayıtdılar, On Bir şagirdi vә onlarla birlikdә olanları bir yerdә toplaşmış gördülәr.
Bunlar deyirdi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!”

block.text: <<Rәbb, doğrudan da, dirilmiş vә Şimona görünmüşdür>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They related the things that happened along the way, and how he was recognized by them in the breaking of the bread.

block.text: Onlar da yolda baş verәnlәri vә çörәyi böldüyü zaman Onu necә tanıdıqlarını nәql etdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they said these things, Jesus himself stood among them, and said to them,

block.text: Onlar bu barәdә danışarkәn İsa Özü aralarında durub onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Peace be to you.”

block.text: <<Sizә salam olsun!>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they were terrified and filled with fear, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.
He said to them,

block.text: Onlarsa çaşıb dәhşәtә gәlәrәk bir ruh gördüklәrini zәnn etdilәr.
Amma İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why are you troubled? Why do doubts arise in your hearts?

block.text: <<Nә üçün tәlaşa düşürsünüz? Nәyә görә ürәklәrinizә belә fikirlәr gәlir?

ReferenceBlocks.text: See my hands and my feet, that it is truly me. Touch me and see, for a spirit doesn't have flesh and bones, as you see that I have.”

block.text: Әllәrimә vә ayaqlarıma baxın. Bu – Mәn Özümәm! Mәnә toxunun vә baxın, çünki Mәndә olduğunu gördüyünüz kimi ruhun әti vә sümüyü olmur>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his feet.

block.text: İsa bunu deyib onlara әllәrini vә ayaqlarını göstәrdi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: While they still didn't believe for joy, and wondered, he said to them,

block.text: Onlar hәlә sevincdәn inanmayıb heyrәtlәnәrkәn İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you have anything here to eat?”

block.text: <<Burada yemәyә bir şey varmı?>>

ReferenceBlocks.text: They gave him a piece of a broiled fish and some honeycomb.

block.text: Ona bir tikә bişmiş balıq verdilәr.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He took them, and ate in front of them.
He said to them,

block.text: İsa da yemәyi götürüb onların qabağında yedi.
Sonra İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is what I told you, while I was still with you, that all things which are written in the law of Moses, the prophets, and the psalms, concerning me must be fulfilled.”

block.text: <<Sizinlә birgә olarkәn söylәdiyim sözlәr bunlardır: Musanın Qanununda, Peyğәmbәrlәrin kitablarında vә Zәburda Mәnim haqqımda yazılanların yerinә yetirilmәsi lazımdır>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he opened their minds, that they might understand the Scriptures.
He said to them,

block.text: Bundan sonra Müqәddәs Yazıları anlamaq üçün onların zehnini açdı.
İsa onlara dedi:

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Thus it is written: The Christ will suffer and will rise from the dead the third day.

block.text: <<Belә yazılıb: Mәsih әzab çәkib üçüncü gün ölülәr arasından dirilmәlidir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And repentance and the remission of sins will be preached in his name to all the nations, beginning at Jerusalem.

block.text: Yerusәlimdәn başlayaraq bütün millәtlәrә günahların bağışlanması üçün tövbә Onun adı ilә vәz edilmәlidir.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are witnesses of these things.

block.text: Siz bu hadisәlәrin şahidisiniz.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, I send forth what my Father has promised you. But wait in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from on high.”

block.text: Budur, Mәn Öz Atamın vәd etdiyini sizә göndәrәcәyәm. Sizsә ucalardan gәlәn qüvvәyә bürünәnәdәk bu şәhәrdә qalın>>.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He led them out as far as Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.

block.text: İsa onları şәhәrdәn kәnara çıxarıb Bet-Anyayadәk gәtirdi vә әllәrini qaldırıb onlara xeyir-dua verdi;

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, while he blessed them, that he withdrew from them, and was carried up into heaven.

block.text: xeyir-dua verәrkәn onlardan uzaqlaşdı vә göyә aparıldı.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They worshiped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy.

block.text: Şagirdlәri dә İsaya sәcdә etdilәr vә böyük sevinclә Yerusәlimә qayıtdılar.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.

block.text: Onlar daim Allaha alqış edәrәk mәbәddә olurdular.
